title: Well Testing Program Intern
description:
Raritan Headwaters Association (RHA) is a non-profit conservation organization with a South Branch office located in Flemington, New Jersey. Established in 1974, RHA’s Well Testing Program has been reliably testing private wells and collecting groundwater quality data throughout the North and South Branch Raritan River watershed region. Since testing is not mandatory for private well owners, this public health service enables residents to conveniently and affordably screen for harmful contaminants of local concern. The Community Well Testing Program currently partners with 22 municipalities to offer residents the opportunity to test their water during RHA events.

Applicants are encouraged to visit our website at www.TestMyWell.org to learn more about the program.

**About the Position:** RHA is seeking candidates for the Well Testing Program Intern position for fall 2024. This internship offers an opportunity to gain valuable experience working with our organization, learning about the importance of drinking water testing and groundwater quality monitoring while educating and engaging with the community.

Interns will work closely with the organization’s Well Testing Program Manager to prepare for and participate in testing events. Responsibilities include assembling testing kits and materials, educating residents on relevant topics, and assisting with community outreach tasks and events.

**Qualifications:** Qualified applicants should have a strong interest in water quality, environmental health and/or policy, or a related field. Applicants must be comfortable working with volunteers and community members. Preferred candidates should have transportation to various locations throughout the watershed.

**Hours:** 8–10 hours/week

**Start Date:** Early September **End Date:** Mid November

**Location:** Events are primarily held on Saturday mornings at various public locations throughout the watershed. Additional flexible hours are required during the week at the RHA South Branch office in Flemington, NJ.

**Compensation:** $17/hour plus mileage reimbursement

**How to Apply:** Send an email with “Well Testing Program Internship – Application – Last Name” in the subject line to Samantha LaRocca, Well Testing Program Manager, at slarocca@raritanheadwaters.org. Include a resume outlining relevant experience, skills, and interests; cover letters are encouraged.

Applications will be accepted through August 28th or until the position is filled.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Expected hours: 8 – 10 per week

Schedule:

* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Porter/Handyman (Residential Condo)
description:
**Company Overview**

Safety Facility Services is an industry-leading provider of comprehensive facility maintenance services for commercial and residential properties of all sizes. We utilize customized technology and specialized systems to support our team of trained professionals, helping us deliver exceptional services to our customers. Founded in 1992 and currently servicing over 10mm SQF with over 500 employees, our company has evolved to include specialists in commercial cleaning, engineering and operations, architectural maintenance (metal, marble and wood), pest control, security, and lighting and energy solutions. And we’re about being sustainable, for your budget and the environment. It’s why we’re the fastest growing team in the eastern US.

**OUR VALUES**  
Our company is comprised of a of a set of operating principles called "core values". They are “Mary Minds, One Mission; Everything with Integrity; Be Accountable; and Adapt & Grow. These core values serve as the foundation for who we are as a company, how we conduct business, interact with our customers and, last but certainly not least, each other. We have a grand vision to be the best at what we do while also "Building a Great Place to work".

**Job Title:** Porter/Handyman

**Job Duties:** General maintenance of a residential condo building which include but not limited to: Sweep, mop, garbage removal, minor repairs/handyman duties

**Schedule:** Sunday - Thursday (1 hour unpaid lunch)

* Monday, Wednesday (8:00AM - 4:00PM)
* Tuesday, Thursday (8:30AM - 3:00PM)
* Sunday (11:00AM - 3:00PM)
* Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday you will return from 8:00PM - 9:00PM to make sure all garbage is taken out

**Pay Rate:** $21.00

**1-3 years of experience in maintenance and handyman experience**

**Physical Requirements:** walking and standing during the entire shift (often 4-8 hours), climbing stairs, kneeling to clean floors, pushing and pulling objects, lifting and moving objects (up to 50 lbs), repetitive bending and lifting, and repetitive arm movement.

**EEO Statement:** We are an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of the company to hire, train, promote and pay its associates without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, citizenship status, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation or veteran status.

**Disclaimer**: The above statement is intendant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the incumbent (s) of the job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and activities required of the position. Other duties, responsibilities and activities may change or be assigned at any time with or without notice.

**Diversity Statement:**  
Safety Facility Services is committed to fostering, cultivating, and preserving a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion. Our human capital is the most valuable asset we have. The collective sum of the individual differences, life experiences, knowledge, inventiveness, innovation, self-expression, unique capabilities and talent that our employees invest in their work represents a significant part of not only our culture, but our reputation and company’s achievement as well.

We embrace and encourage our employees’ differences in age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other characteristics that make our employees unique.

title: Client Liaison
description:
**Job description**

**Full Job Description**

For more than three decades California Closets has built a reputation on delivering truly custom products and unparalleled service to our clients. We have helped transform spaces, enhanced homes and allowed people to get more out of life.

As the first point of contact, it is paramount that this candidate is personable and able to establish a professional relationship with clients. The ideal candidate will bring a positive, friendly, and helpful personality to lead our showroom teams in delivering on the California Closets experience.

**Job Summary:**

The Client Liaison will work with others to respond to customer inquiries, book design appointments, and assist clients in the showroom. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who enjoys working in a team environment focused on exceptional client experiences.

**Responsibilities:**

* Answer & direct incoming phone calls
* Schedule appointments for clients with our Design Consultants
* Complete COI’s [certificate of insurance] for upcoming installations
* Assist customers in the showroom, providing information about product and services
* Assist clients picking up or dropping off material at the showroom [shelving, hardware, etc.]
* Maintain white glove cleanliness of the showroom
* All other duties as assigned.

**Required Skills/Abilities:**

* Customer Service experience in retail, hospitality, call center, or similar.
* Available to work weekdays 9am-5pm with rotating Saturdays.
* Available to work in both Tribeca and Upper East Side on a weekly basis
* Experience with CRM software, MS Office, email, and internet
* Professional appearance
* Reliable

**Personal Qualifications:**

* Self-motivated and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
* Ability to multi-task and deal with a wide variety of people.
* Personable with effective communication skills – both written and verbal, with a wide variety of people.
* Ability to enter data while on the phone with a client.
* Manage time effectively.
* Ability to quickly learn the features and benefits of our products.
* Problem solving skills.

**Benefits:**

* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance.
* 401k with match
* Paid time off
* A rewarding job with a fast-growing company

**Physical Requirements:**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Must be able to lift up to 20 pounds at times.

title: Cosmetology Instructor Bilingual
description:
**About Us:**

The International Barber and Beauty Institute (IBBI), located in Central Islip, NY, is a premier institution dedicated to providing top-tier education and training in the barbering and cosmetology industries. Our mission is to cultivate the next generation of skilled professionals through comprehensive programs, hands-on training, and a commitment to excellence.

**Position: Cosmetology Instructor**

**Job Description:**

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Cosmetology Instructor to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a robust background in cosmetology or esthetics and a genuine passion for teaching and mentoring students. As a Cosmetology Instructor at IBBI, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our students by providing both technical expertise and professional guidance.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Deliver high-quality instruction in various cosmetology techniques, including hair cutting, coloring, styling, skincare, and nail care.
* Develop and implement engaging lesson plans that align with the curriculum standards and educational objectives of IBBI.
* Provide hands-on training and supervision to ensure students acquire practical skills and confidence.
* Assess student progress and offer constructive feedback to aid their improvement.
* Maintain a positive and motivating learning environment.
* Stay current with industry trends and advancements in cosmetology.
* Ensure compliance with state licensing requirements and school policies.
* Mentor and support students in their professional development and career readiness.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience as a professional cosmetologist or esthetician.
* Previous teaching or instructional experience is highly desirable.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to motivate and inspire students.
* Commitment to ongoing professional development and staying updated with industry trends.
* Valid cosmetology or esthetics license in the state of New York.

**Why Join Us?**

* Be part of a respected institution with a reputation for excellence in education.
* Opportunity to shape the future of the beauty industry.
* Collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.

If you are passionate about cosmetology and have a desire to train and inspire the next generation of beauty professionals, we would love to hear from you. Join us at the International Barber and Beauty Institute and make a lasting impact on the lives of our students.

**How to Apply:**

Interested candidates are invited to email their resume, cover letter, and any relevant certifications to .

For more information about our school, please visit our website at www.ibi-bli.com.

International Barber and Beauty Institute

title: Service Center Representative
company: Teachers' Retirement System of The City of New York
description:
Since 1917, Teachers’ Retirement System of the City of New York (TRS) has been building better tomorrows for the educators of New York City. TRS serves over 215,000 members with a mission to provide them retirement, disability, and death benefit services.

The Service Center Representative role is responsible for providing exceptional customer experience and solutions to active and inactive members, retirees, and beneficiaries. The successful candidate is highly motivated and will go the ‘extra mile’ to provide high-quality service.

Under the direction of the Contact Center Manager, the duties and responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to, the following:

* Answer all service center calls and respond to members' questions while providing exceptional service across all communication channels (telephone, email, chat);
* Comprehend and review details of existing/historical data regarding inquiry in system to provide members with necessary information;
* Respond and resolve all member inquiries and requests on first contact to avoid follow-up and other assistance;
* Research and examine all relevant information to assess validity of concern, determine possible causes and resolutions;
* Manage difficult and/or emotional customer situations, respond promptly to customer needs, and solicit customer feedback to improve service;
* Work as an active member of the team to minimize customer hold time and reduce call-backs and escalations;
* Utilize good judgment and possess the ability to handle highly confidential material and information;

Perform other duties as required.

**WHAT WE OFFER**

TRSNYC offers a comprehensive benefits package:

* 9a-5p schedule and hybrid work schedule, work/life balance;
* PTO, holidays, sick leave;
* Health benefits, dental and vision coverage, prescription drug plans, Flexible Spending Programs (FSA), and commuter benefits plan;
* Retirement savings plan (The New York Employees' Retirement System);
* Professional Development;
* Scholarships and college savings program;
* Employee Assistance Programs (EAP);
* Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF)

**MINIMUM QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS**

1. An associate degree or completion of 60 semester credits from an accredited college and either:

* one year of satisfactory full-time experience performing analytical, administrative or customer service tasks; or
* one year of satisfactory full-time experience performing mathematical, statistical, actuarial, or accounting computations in one or more of the following:
* a retirement or employee benefits plan; and/or
* for customer service in a financial institution; and/or
* in a position requiring the application of law, rules, and regulations and the use of statistical, actuarial, or similar tables; or

2. An associate degree or completion of 60 semester credits from an accredited college, including or supplemented by 9 semester credits in mathematics, statistics, accounting, economics, finance, data analytics, project management, business administration, public administration and/or actuarial science; or

3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and two years of satisfactory full-time experience performing mathematical, statistical, actuarial, or accounting computations in one or more of the following:

* a retirement or employee benefits plan; and/or
* for customer service in a financial institution; and/or
* in a position requiring the application of law, rules, and regulations and the use of statistical, actuarial, or similar tables; or

4. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and three years of satisfactory full-time experience performing analytical, administrative or customer service tasks.

**PREFERRED SKILLS IN ADDITION TO MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS**

· Demonstrated customer service experience. Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills; and the temperament to interact with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner.

· Outstanding attention to detail, and the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks.

· Excellent interpersonal, communication (verbal and written) and organizational skills (includes Microsoft Office Suite proficiency and Automatic Call Distribution System (ACD)).

title: Verizon Sales Associate
description:
Our firm provides the highest quality and most profitable service to our client base which has obliged us to increase our account management division. We are currently in search of a Verizon Sales Associate to foster the expansion of our clients’ requirements. The Verizon Sales Associate will be working within a team and will be required to maintain a full knowledge base of the client they are representing. The Verizon Sales Associate will ultimately have the opportunity to move into an executive account management position and manage an entire territory.

Our Verizon Sales Associate team is responsible for utilizing their relationship-building skills to provide not only unparalleled service for our customers but for our clients. Other responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Operate as the lead point of contact for our potential new leads and anyone on their team working with them
* Develop market intelligence on the territory assigned and potential competitors
* Understand and evaluate various market and sales trends occurring within the existing region they are working in
* Be the liaison between our clients and potential customers
* Develop strong leadership and management skills within the role

title: CT Technology/ CT Scan Tech
description:
CT Technologist

Location: [Insert Location]

Overview:  
Join our team as a CT Technologist where you will play a crucial role in conducting diagnostic imaging procedures using computed tomography (CT) technology. As a CT Technologist, you will work in a dynamic healthcare setting, utilizing your expertise to produce high-quality images for accurate patient diagnosis and treatment planning.

Responsibilities:  
- Perform CT scans on patients following protocols to ensure high-quality images.  
- Operate and maintain CT equipment, ensuring proper functionality and safety standards.  
- Collaborate with radiologists and healthcare providers to discuss imaging results and patient care plans.  
- Maintain patient records and ensure confidentiality of sensitive information.  
- Adhere to radiation safety protocols and best practices during imaging procedures.  
- Assist in patient positioning to obtain optimal imaging results.  
- Monitor patients during scans and address any concerns or reactions promptly.  
- Participate in quality assurance activities to uphold imaging standards.

Skills:  
- Proficiency in CT imaging techniques and equipment operation.  
- Strong knowledge of anatomy and physiology to accurately interpret images.  
- Familiarity with aseptic techniques for infection control during procedures.  
- Experience with PET scans, diagnostic radiology, mammography, X-Ray, and nuclear medicine is advantageous.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment such as a Level I Trauma Center or urgent care facility.  
- Excellent communication skills to interact effectively with patients and healthcare team members.

If you are a skilled CT Technologist with a passion for delivering exceptional patient care through precise imaging procedures, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in providing top-notch diagnostic services that make a difference in patient outcomes.

title: Patient Care Representative
Sales Manager
description:
**Position Purpose:**

We are seeking an experienced, tenacious and highly motivated individual to join our team as Sales Manager. The Sales Manager is responsible for driving revenue growth and achieving sales targets. This role involves developing sales strategies, building client relationships, and overseeing the sales process from prospecting to closing.

**Market Segments:**

* Group (SMERF)
* Corporate Negotiated.

**Essential Functions & Duties:**

* Manage and direct the on-property multi-segment sales efforts to achieve hotel revenue goals by proactively targeting current and prospecting new targeted accounts in these markets to grow Casa Cipriani New Yorks business.
* Implementation of effective sales deployment strategies to grow market share.
* Monitoring customer experience from arrival to departure
* Leading a seamless transition from sales to service in a timely fashion for quality service delivery and, where appropriate, orchestrating operational execution due to the complexity or some guest’s requirements/needs.
* Conducting site inspections, client entertaining, sales trips and trade shows as required.
* Must be well versed and effective in selling high rated, luxury suites with a keen understanding of the ultra-luxury market.
* Work closing with the Director of Catering at ‘Cipriani 10 South Street event venue’ to handle all group and corporate leads funneled through.
* Implement Casa Cipriani’s service strategy and represent the brand in all aspects of the sales process, with the goal of driving customer loyalty through service excellence.
* Ability to be well versed on current trends in various markets and maintain confidentiality of information.
* Must be able to effectively communicate both verbally and written with all levels of employees and guests in an attentive, friendly, courteous, and service oriented manner.
* Engage with club members, as appropriate, long term stay inquiries for members.
* Administration & Sales
* Achieve daily and monthly targeted number of sales activities with effectiveness
* Plan a minimum of 5 site inspections/entertainment meetings per week to qualified potential accounts or new accounts
* Solicit new and existing corporate/group accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals through telephone prospecting, outside sales calls, site inspections and written communication
* Assist hotel clients and local community business events to network and maintain high visibility
* Up-sell, cross-sell and promote Hotel facilities & services at every available opportunity to maximize sales revenue
* Attend local and domestic trade shows, key client events, sales trip as planned, submitted and approved at the beginning of each year and updated calendar at each quarter.
* Update management and relevant departments on VIP arrivals, meet and greet accordingly
* Host meticulous site inspections to deliver the brand promise providing exceptional customer service at all times
* Provide positive and constructive feedback as necessary to the respective Heads of Department
* Prepare monthly action plan for main market segment and implement an account development plan for key accounts to achieve maximum revenue in both short and long term
* Fully responsible of accounts under his/her management to achieve financial and non-financial objectives, including contracting, updating profile, and renewing contracts
* Work closely with DORM to ensure pricing strategy across market segments are aligned to meet & exceed revenue targets
* Work closely with DOSM and assist with contributing towards the preparation of the Annual Business Plan relevant to your market segments
* To attend weekly yield meetings and monthly strategic meetings to develop and adjust sales strategies, short term pricing and channel tactics
* Perform monthly review account profile on room nights production and average rate and utilize Agency 360 & Demand 360 and relevant business intelligence tools to maximize ROI
* Monitor competitors’ rate strategy, account penetration and marketing activities to maintain a competitive edge
* Update Director of Sales & Marketing on market trends and business leads
* Ensure that all accounts profile, all sales reports and any other relevant information are updated in the CRM system
* Personnel & Other Duties
* Identify and communicate ideas, customer expectations from assigned segments and territory
* Develop and maintain positive and productive working relationships with other colleagues and departments
* Follow company and department policies and procedures
* Ensure dress-code and personal appearance are clean, hygienic, professional and in compliance with company policies and procedures

**Knowledge, Experience & Skills**

* Two plus years of previous experience as a sales manager, or in a similar role in the hospitality industry.
* Experience with technology such as
* Delphi.fdc (sales force)
* Opera Cloud
* Alliants
* Microsoft Office Suites
* Hoteligence/Demand 360
* Corporate Negotiated account relationships and experience.
* Results-oriented mindset, with a focus on meeting and exceeding sales goals and driving business growth.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing market conditions and business priorities.
* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail, with the ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.

**PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS OF THIS POSITION:**

* Ability to stand, walk, and move around for extended periods, particularly during client meetings, presentations, and networking events.
* Lift and carry promotional materials, sales collateral, and equipment weighing up to 40 pounds, as needed for presentations and demonstrations.
* Visual acuity and depth perception to read and interpret documents, analyze data, and navigate sales materials effectively.
* Ability to adapt to various work environments, including office settings, client sites, and remote locations, while maintaining focus and productivity.
* Flexibility to work occasional evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed to accommodate client schedules and business demands.

**INTENT AND FUNCTION OF JOB DESCRIPTIONS**

All descriptions have been reviewed to ensure that only essential functions and basic duties have been included. Peripheral tasks, only incidentally related to each position, have been excluded. Requirements, skills, and abilities included have been determined to be the minimal standards required to successfully perform the positions. In no instance, however, should the duties, responsibilities, and requirements delineated be interpreted as all-inclusive. Additional functions and requirements may be assigned by supervisors as deemed appropriate. Job descriptions are not intended as and do not create employment contracts. The organization maintains its status as an at-will employer.

***Cipriani is an equal opportunity employer.***

title: Operations Manager
description:
**Summary**

The Operations Manager is responsible for overseeing the administrative and operational functions of the marijuana cultivation facility. This includes managing hiring processes, scheduling, ordering supplies, overseeing inventory and wholesaling, ensuring compliance with state and local regulations, and maintaining safety and security protocols. The Operations Manager plays a key role in the smooth functioning of the facility, ensuring that all operations run efficiently and effectively.

**Essential Functions**

* **Hiring and Staffing**: Recruit, hire, and train new employees. Develop staffing schedules to ensure optimal coverage.
* **Scheduling**: Coordinate and manage work schedules for all staff to ensure smooth operations.
* **Supplies and Inventory**: Order and manage supplies, maintain accurate inventory records, and oversee the wholesaling process.
* **Compliance**: Ensure all aspects of state and local compliance are met, including documentation, reporting, and adherence to regulations.
* **Safety and Security**: Develop and implement safety and security protocols to protect staff and the facility. Conduct regular safety audits and training sessions.
* **Administrative Duties**: Oversee administrative tasks, including record-keeping, reporting, and other office duties as needed.
* **Budget Management**: Assist in budget preparation and manage expenditures to ensure cost-effective operations.
* **Communication**: Serve as the main point of contact for internal and external stakeholders. Communicate effectively with team members, management, and vendors.
* **Problem-Solving**: Address and resolve any issues or challenges that arise in daily operations.
* **Continuous Improvement**: Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement changes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* **Other Duties**: Perform other related duties as assigned by the Chief Executive Officer (CEO).

**Preferred Qualifications and Education Requirements**

* Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in operations management, preferably in the cannabis industry or a similar regulated industry.
* Strong understanding of state and local compliance requirements for marijuana cultivation facilities.
* Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Proficiency in using office software and inventory management systems.
* Exceptional communication and problem-solving skills.

Exempt

We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.*

title: Department Manager
description:
**Job Description** **Overall Job Summary:** At H&M we refer to our Assistant Managers as Department Managers and you are responsible for supporting the Sales and Profit goals in the store by setting a plan to deliver the Best Customer Experience in the department and overall store. The Department Manager will ensure that you have the Best Team and support their development, as well as work with succession planning, talent development, and structured performance management for the team based on results, values, and leadership. The Department Manager will work in accordance with legal requirements and H&M standards, policies, and procedures to meet the expectations of customers and colleagues.


This position reports to the Store Manager and has the following direct reports: Department Supervisor, Sales Advisor.

**Your Day to Day\\***


Sales and Profit

* Regularly analyze and follow up on Sales & Profit KPIs for the department with the Visual Merchandisers. Secure that actions are taken to maximize selling. Support the Visual Merchandisers with these actions by securing the hours and staff needed for a successful execution
* Together with the store management team, secure store operations, H&M standards, and best practices are followed through proper scheduling to maximize conversion and enable commercial activities (Move, Sales, Events, etc.) and excellent customer service keeping within the sales budget of allocated hours.
* Plan and prioritize actions together with your team that have a clear impact on selling and ensure the implementation of the Commercial Handbook
* Ensure H&M Customer Service standards are always delivered through active coaching and leading by example
* Actively participate in executing store routines and tasks including but not limited to the delivery truck, garment processing, reductions, department moves and price change
* Actively prevent loss and ensure the department follows appropriate safety and security guidelines
* Give input to the Store Manager and Area Teams on allocation and replenishment to secure garment levels according to sales trends and inform the Store Manager of any potential risks, threats, and opportunities related to the competitor landscape


People and Teams

* Manage the recruitment, training, development, and succession planning team in line with H&M best practices
* Evaluate and manage the performance of the Department team members; give regular feedback, execute dialogues, development plans, and follow ups and take actions to improve performance and develop the team
* Deliver clear communication to Store team on business performance, company culture, and training focuses through daily Behind The Seams meetings and participating in weekly Leadership Meetings
* Ensure that health & safety, legal, and security issues are being handled to H&M standards and local laws, securing the employee and customer safety at all times
* Carry out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with H&M policies and applicable laws including time-off requests, pay, conducting terminations & corrective actions, and making employment decisions
* Ability to maintain overall store responsibility in absence of Store Manager
* Strengthen our Company Culture by promoting feedback in our daily work and coach your team to do the same

  

**Qualifications** **Who You Are**

* Inclusive, positive, creative, and willing to learn on the job!
* Passionate for customer service and helping people find their style
* A multi-tasker who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment with an eye for detail
* 1-2+ years of transferrable experience welcome
* You have the ability to lift in excess of 20 pounds
* Ability to coach and counsel staff on management and progressive discipline techniques
* Ability to stand for long periods of time, bend, stretch, engage in repetitive motions, push, pull and carry items (mannequins, clothing, totes, torsos, etc.) for a short distance
* Ability to climb a ladder and use a step stool
* Open availability including evenings and weekends
* Basic computer skills such as browser navigation, software interaction, and data entry are needed
* May be required to travel to support other stores and for training

**Why You’ll Love Working for H&M**

* Dynamic, team-driven work environment with a group of unique, diverse, and kind individuals.
* Endless growth & development opportunities.
* Dress your personality. We encourage you to dress your personality all day, every day.
* Did we mention our discount at H&M, &Other Stories, and COS?

  

**Additional Information** **Job Status:** Hourly, Non-Exempt

**Compensation**: *Hiring Range is $*$21.87- $24.60 Hourly\\*\\*

**EEOC Code:** SLS

* This job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. There may be additional duties and responsibilities assigned for this job at the company’s discretion.


\\*\\*H&M, in good faith, believes that this posted range of compensation is the accurate range for this role at this location at the time of this posting. H&M may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range depending on candidate qualifications. This range may be modified in the future.

**Benefits:**

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*

*We offer: 25% Staff Discount - Medical, Pharmacy Vision and Dental Coverage – Employee Assistance Program - Vacation, Wellness, Holiday and Parental Pay – 401K – Commuter Benefits, Health and Dependent Care FSA. Plus, additional Voluntary Benefits.*

**Inclusion & Diversity:**

*H&M**is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation.* *Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas**. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*

*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*

**Company Description:**


H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: Membership Counselor
description:
**Who Are We?**

LA Fitness is a privately owned fitness club chain. LA Fitness has hundreds of health clubs and millions of members across US and Canada. In an industry often equated with fad and fashion, LA Fitness has steadily increased its presence by focusing on the one lifelong benefit valued by everyone: good health.

**About Us**

Founded in Southern California in 1984, LA Fitness continues to seek innovative ways to enhance the physical and emotional well-being of our increasingly diverse membership base.

With our wide range of amenities and highly trained staff, we provide fun and effective workout options to family members of all ages and interests.

**Position: Sales Counselor (SC)**

Do you have a passion for helping people with their health and wellness goals? Can you use those passions to influence others to make positive changes to their lifestyle? We are looking to bring high energy and positive individuals with a background in fitness to join our team as Fitness Sales Consultants.

We are actively recruiting candidates to take part in our rapidly growing NJ/NY Markets. In search of Sales representatives with the aspirations to grow into future Assistant General Managers or General Managers roles due to our explosive growth. Candidates must be Passionate for Fitness, Sales, Marketing, Self-Motivated and Disciplined, Well Organized, and Looking for Career Advancement. Here at LA FITNESS, we are looking for candidates that represent H.E.A.T.; Honest - Enthusiastic - Achievement Oriented - Team Players.

**Job Description**

**The Top 4 Duties of a SC are to act as a:**

﻿﻿Personal Performance - meet/exceed company standards with personal commissions and VCLASS production

﻿﻿Personal Sales Process - show full competency in sales process knowledge.

﻿﻿Personal Customer Service - show ability to always be on time, in uniform, and positively enthusiastic with members, guests, and coworkers.

**What We Expect from You**

* To consistently demonstrate a positive attitude and a strong work ethic we will teach you the skills necessary to build a distinguished career, but you must provide the proper foundation.
* Write good personal commissions consistently
* Achieve company VCLASS standards consistently, VIPs (4) per sale - Calls (60) per day - Leads (15) per day - Appts (5) 1st time per day - Show (3) per day - Sales (3) per day.
* Show competency with rates, commissions, SMT, digital price presentation, F.A.

Questions.

* Provide awareness within the local community of what LA Fitness has to offer as well as the ability to create a sense of urgency in becoming a part of our member base.
* Generate personal contacts, business contacts along with daily appointments to tour our facility from your marketing efforts.
* Knowledge within community events ensuring club participation and are actively involved.
* Exceptional external marketing and relationship building through our community outreach program.
* Ability to excel in an environment that sets goals, tracks progress, and strives for growth.
* Ability to effectively communicate expectations to staff and create a winning culture.
* Possess excellent time management, organizational and follow-up skills.
* Must be enthusiastic, energetic, personable, and friendly as well as passionate.
* Previous sales experience required
* To always act with integrity and confidence that what we offer is worth far more than what we ask for it.

**What You Can Expect From Us**

* To be able to advance as high as your performance takes you. The sky is the limit for those who excel.
* To be able to steadily increase your income each month through Downline Bonuses as your client base grows.
* To learn Sales skills, Life skills, Negotiating skills, Time management skills, Leadership skills, People skills and Problem-solving skills.
* An opportunity for an ever-changing career, filled with challenge, opportunity, variety, and satisfaction.

﻿﻿Personal Systems - manage your daily planner, guest register, callback list, and success report at company standards.

**Keys to Success / Advancement**

﻿﻿Uphold and support LA Fitness policies positively and enthusiastically.

﻿﻿Consistently maintain strong personal commissions & VCLASS production.

﻿﻿Line up personally each day as well or better than your best team member. Demonstrate the daily discipline necessary to consistently excel.

﻿﻿Train all day, every day. We can all use daily reminders and guidance.

﻿﻿Take full ownership of your own success.

﻿﻿Exude confidence, and you'll inspire confidence. Dream big. You will never be better than what you can imagine.

﻿﻿Have an enthusiastic work ethic. success only comes before work in the dictionary.

﻿﻿Remember, the world is full of talented failures. discipline is what creates superstars.

**Benefits**

﻿﻿Commission

﻿﻿Bonus incentives

﻿﻿Medical insurance after 90 days

﻿﻿Growth opportunities

﻿﻿Complimentary membership

﻿﻿Full-time position: this position requires 40 hours worked each week.

﻿﻿Evening and weekend hours are required

title: Associate Manager, A&R and Content Acquisition
description:
Job Description:
At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:* Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.
* Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.
* Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.
* Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.


We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.
Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.
A little bit about our team:
The Business & Legal Affairs department provides global business and legal support to Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA), which offers distribution, sales, and label services to a wide variety of third party record labels and artists.
Your role:
The Associate Manager will play a crucial role in driving A&R communications and streamlining the deal making process across ADA. This role will have a direct supporting relationship to the Vice President of Content Acquisition, will work closely with Legal and Business Affairs and Finance teams, and will collaborate with several other departments and global ADA team members.
Here you’ll get to:* Cultivate a network of contacts within the independent music community, and make creative connections with a goal of drawing incremental business
* Track deal flow across all active conversations, coordinating information and deliverables across teams
* Obtain, submit, and file financial approvals through all corporate delegation levels
* Research and circulate potential label and artist details for ADA staff as preparation for wider pitch meetings
* Produce and maintain reports and charts to communicate deal strategies and track progress
* Work with the finance teams on deal modelling, collaborating on comparable artists, growth trends and projections
* Support the business and legal affairs team throughout the negotiation process to ensure accuracy across deal terms and structures
* Attend concerts, studio sessions and playbacks as needed


About you:* You are highly organized with a strong attention to detail and follow up
* You enjoy working in a fast paced work environment requiring strong multitasking skills, excellent time management, and an ability to self-prioritize your workload
* You have excellent interpersonal skills and are a strategic thinker who is results-oriented
* You have excellent communication skills (both written and oral)
* You are experienced with Microsoft office, including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
* You have the ability to track a large volumes of data surrounding of deals, conversations, and partnerships, with the aim of achieving a mutually beneficial outcome for all
* You are a problem solver, with the ablilty to escalate items as needed in order to work through roadblocks and accelerate timelines
* You are experienced in maintaining highly confidential and sensitive information


We’d love it if you also had:* A college degree preferred
* Experience with/in the independent distribution space
* You have 1-3 previous years of experience in a contract administration, finance, or A&R role


About us:
As the home to 10K Projects, 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Warner Music Group is also home to ADA, which supports the independent community, as well as artist services division WMX. In addition, WMG counts film and television storytelling powerhouse Warner Music Entertainment among its many brands.
Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.  

Love this job and want to apply?  

Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.
Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.  

  

#LI-Hybrid and #LI-Onsite
This position will require being in the office 4 days a week. We believe that an in-office presence is critical for talent development, collaboration and building strong relationships.
Salary Range
$63,000 - $70,000 Annually*Salary ranges are included for job postings where required by law.**The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as work experience and business needs. The pay range is subject to change at any time dependent on a variety of internal and external factors.*
WMG is committed to inclusion and diversity in all aspects of our business. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and will evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Assistant Project Manager (Commercial Construction)
description:
**Front Line Consulting**

Frontline Consulting focuses on providing Program Management and Process Improvements. We are a Veteran owned and Veteran managed company committed to improving the holistic performance of the organizations that seek our services. We combine traditional Project Management and Agile principles with the knowledge and insights gained from decades of military experience. This blend of the professional framework with martial leadership allows us to offer a rare consulting service of adaptability and lasting improvement to our customers.

We are currently looking for a **Assistant Project Manager** **(Commercial)** to work with a large state agency with consultant procurement on various projects. This position is based out of the Randall's Island, NY office.

**Position Scope**

The APM will work with staff on project control activities including project document management, RFI and IB tracking, contract document review, pre award meetings, schedules, monitoring of building construction, repair, and rehabilitation projects from planning stages through the completion of construction. The APM will assure that proposals meet client needs, are within cost limitations, and project elements are completed per schedule. This APM needs to be self-sufficient and proficient in reading contract documents, able to read, understand, check for compliance and process RFI’s, submittals, change orders and daily correspondences.

**Daily Tasks**

Allocate resources for assigned projects

Interface with project inspectors, contractors, architects, engineers, city and county officials, and client

Communicate and follow up with contractors about specific projects and their goals

Communicate with site superintendents about delays and any other issues that must be communicated to clients

Responsible for cost estimating, project scheduling, resource management (including labor, material, and equipment scheduling), construction document reading, and interpretation

RFI Tracking, Contract Document review, Review Payments, Submittals, and Change Orders

**Required Qualifications**

Minimum of 4 years as a Project Engineer/APM, experience in public or private proposals, compliance, and construction

Minimum of 1 year experience in public commercial construction on College, Medical, or Prison facilities

Understanding of all facets of the construction process

Understanding of electrical and audio visual installations

Familiarity with scheduling software (Primavera P6) is preferred

OSHA 30

Microsoft Office Experience

**Preferred Qualifications**

Excellent leadership skills

Ability to communicate clearly and concisely; both verbally and in writing

Familiarity with Project Management Information Systems (Microsoft Project, Procure, etc)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Public Agency: 1 year (Preferred)
* Microsoft Office/Excel: 1 year (Preferred)
* Project Engineer/APM: 4 years (Preferred)
* Commercial Construction: 6 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* OSHA 30 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Graphic Animation Artist
description:
**ABOUT THE NATIONAL HOCKEY LEAGUE**  

Founded in 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL®) is the premier professional ice hockey league in the world, and is one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada.  

  

With more than 1500 employees across the US and Canada, the NHL is a global sports and entertainment organization committed to building healthy and vibrant communities using the sport of hockey to celebrate fans of every race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and socio-economic status.  

  

At the NHL, we are looking for dynamic, energetic and impactful individuals who are committed to doing the same by sharing in our philosophy that Hockey is for Everyone – and inclusion belongs on the ice, in the locker rooms, boardrooms and stands.
  

**WHAT WE EXPECT OF YOU**  

  

**SUMMARY**  

The Graphic Animation Artist position is a seasonal temporary full-time position for NHL Productions that will be required to create animations and visual effects for television, digital, corporate presentations, and other forms of media.

This position is temporary, full-time with the potential opportunity to become a permanent staff role.
This position would work a hybrid schedule which consists of work from home and 3 days/nights per week as scheduled in the NYC office. The ideal candidate will have flexibility in working hours based on production demands and timelines.

Start date is anticipated for September 19, 2024.  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Develop and create storyboards that map out key visual scenes within animations
* Implement strong typography skills and graphic design to animate text
* Design and build creative, eye-catching pitch decks in collaboration with senior staff
* Collaborate with senior staff, clients, other animators, and various production staff to review projects, develop timelines and ensure deadlines are met
* Adjust animations and effects after review from senior staff, co-workers and clients
* Budget tracking, time management, technical recommendations for project deliverables
* Possible future for Augmented/Mixed Reality graphics and animations integration

**QUALIFICATIONS**  

**Knowledge Areas/Experience****Required*** Candidate must have extensive experience working in a television multimedia production environment and is an experienced motion graphics designer
* Proven creative track record designing in 2d and 3d space while delivering high-end content under tight deadlines
* Thorough understanding of post-production and all that is required for timely execution of projects
* Mastery of Adobe Creative Cloud applications, including After Effects, Photoshop, and Illustrator as well as Cinema 4D and Boxx. Adobe Premiere edit experience needed
* Impressive portfolio of work and the strong technical skills to back it up

**Preferred*** Maya experience a plus

Additional languages a plus  
* 

**Education/Certifications*** Bachelor’s degree in computer graphics, art, or a related field

 **Required Skills*** Attention to detail; superior organizational and creative skills
* Must be very flexible with working hours, as day and night hours, weekdays and weekends are required as well as being on call for last minute production requirements. Workday can extend as production demands change, so schedule flexibility is a key component to the position.

 **CORE COMPETENCIES**  

These core competencies reflect the underlying values that are necessary to represent the National Hockey League:* *Accountability*
* *Adaptability*
* *Communication*
* *Critical Thinking*
* *Inclusion*
* *Professionalism*
* *Teamwork & Collaboration*

**SALARY RANGE:**
 $50-70/hour

Actual base pay for a successful candidate will be determined based on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to: experience/training, market demands, and geographic location.**When applying, please be sure to include a cover letter with your salary expectations for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. NO EMAILS OR PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Manager, Integrated Solutions
description:
**ABOUT THE NATIONAL HOCKEY LEAGUE**  

Founded in 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL®) is the premier professional ice hockey league in the world, and is one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada.  

  

With more than 1500 employees across the US and Canada, the NHL is a global sports and entertainment organization committed to building healthy and vibrant communities using the sport of hockey to celebrate fans of every race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and socio-economic status.

**WHAT WE EXPECT OF YOU**  

  

**SUMMARY**  

Position will provide cross-functional sales support that will primarily consist of the development of sales materials and assets that will help enhance the overall sales/business development process.  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Support the League’s global business development efforts through the creation of new sales materials. This specifically includes:


 o Sales proposals  

 o Ideation documents  

 o Case studies  

 o Research insights analyses* Assist in the ideation process around the development of custom solutions based on brand briefs provided by new and current NHL partners
* Analyze and formulate custom research developed for sales purposes secured through League research vendors
* Support the sales process through coordination and collaboration with various internal NHL departments

  

**QUALIFICATIONS**  

**Knowledge Areas/Experience****Required*** Strong understanding of sponsorship sales and the sports business landscape
* A minimum of 3-5 years experience in sponsorship sales, partnership marketing or media sales with a sports/entertainment property or consulting/activation agency

 **Education/Certifications*** Undergraduate degree required

 **Required Skills*** High proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Word/Powerpoint/Excel)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Must be a highly motivated and organized individual
* Collaborative and teamwork-focused mentality
* Ability to multi-task in a deadline-driven environment

These core competencies reflect the underlying values that are necessary to represent the National Hockey League:* *Accountability*
* *Adaptability*
* *Communication*
* *Critical Thinking*
* *Inclusion*
* *Professionalism*
* *Teamwork & Collaboration*

  

**The NHL offers U.S. regular, full-time employees:****Time to Recharge**: Utilize our generous Paid Time Off (PTO) to focus on your well-being and ensure a healthy work/life balance. PTO includes paid holidays, vacation, personal and sick days, plus an extra day off for your birthday.**Ability to Focus on your Health:** Along with competitive salaries, the NHL offers comprehensive health benefits to employees and their eligible dependents effective on their first day with us – there is no waiting period. The NHL subsidizes a large portion of the health benefits costs, therefore your cost for medical, dental and vision coverage is minimal.
We also offer our employees and members of their household access to our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to support mental, physical, and financial health. In addition, employees have access to a digital wellness resource designed to improve health and happiness through courses in sleep, movement, and focus. These services are confidential and at no-cost to our employees.**Childcare Leave:** Because your family is the NHL family, employees are offered comprehensive Childcare Leave to welcome your new addition. The primary caregiver to the child is entitled to up to 12 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.

Employees that are not the primary caregiver to the child are entitled to up to 6 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, which must be taken within the first 6 months following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.**Confidence in your Retirement Goals:** Participate in the NHL’s Savings Plan which includes a 401K(pre-tax and Roth options) plus non-elective (employer) contributions to keep your retirement goals on track.**A Hybrid Work Schedule**: The NHL recognizes the value of flexibility in work locations/schedules to help our employees balance work/life priorities. Hybrid work schedules are available for a majority of our roles.**Our New Headquarters:** Our new, state of the art, offices are located at One Manhattan West in Hudson Yards. When you’re in the office, you can conduct meetings in one of our high-tech conference rooms, have lunch with a view or play in the game room. Employees can also enjoy New York’s newest neighborhood that is home to more than 100 shops, culinary experiences, and public artwork.**A Savings for Commuting:** Participate in the NHL’s pre-tax commuter benefit plan whichhelps offset the financial cost of traveling to and from our office.**NHL Partner Rates:** Unlock exclusive pricing from our Partners that include savings on travel, consumer goods and services, plus the NHL Store.**Life at the NHL:** In your first few days, you meet with your new teammates and the HR Team. You have the opportunity to learn more about the NHL and our workplace culture. Employees are invited to play hockey during our Tuesday Night Skate at Chelsea Piers, join our Employee Resource Groups and more. You are a part of our team and we encourage you to be your authentic self, adding to our dynamic workplace culture.**SALARY RANGE:**
 $90-100K

Actual base pay for a successful candidate will be determined based on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to: experience/training, market demands, and geographic location.**When applying, please be sure to include a cover letter with your salary expectations for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. NO EMAILS OR PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Principal Product Manager, Stats & Data, Digital Platforms
description:
**ABOUT THE NATIONAL HOCKEY LEAGUE**  

Founded in 1917, the National Hockey League (NHL®) is the premier professional ice hockey league in the world, and is one of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada.  

  

With more than 1500 employees across the US and Canada, the NHL is a global sports and entertainment organization committed to building healthy and vibrant communities using the sport of hockey to celebrate fans of every race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, age, sexual orientation, and socio-economic status.  

  

At the NHL, we are looking for dynamic, energetic and impactful individuals who are committed to doing the same by sharing in our philosophy that Hockey is for Everyone – and inclusion belongs on the ice, in the locker rooms, boardrooms and stands.
  

**WHAT WE EXPECT OF YOU**  

  

**SUMMARY**  

The National Hockey League is committed to creating compelling digital experiences that bring the excitement of hockey to fans around the globe, while supporting and empowering our 32 member Clubs to do the same. We are seeking a **Principal Product Manager** to join our team and help achieve our mission.  

Our Digital Platforms team’s portfolio includes products such as the NHL App, NHL.com, NHL.TV, streaming and connected device apps, plus support for all 32 Club.com sites and other digital properties & platforms as needed.  

In this role, you will work with a team of dedicated Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, Project Managers and QA team, while partnering with colleagues and stakeholders both inside our organization, and at best-of-breed vendors across the globe.  

Our ideal **Principal Product Manager** knows how to juggle priorities in real-time, build relationships and consensus to help deliver success for the business, the fans, and the team itself.  

You will work within and help shape a complex technical ecosystem, together with both backend and front end teams, and tightly coupled with the NHL App team.  

Your day-to-day will focus on products powered by NHL Stats & Data, with a portfolio across our digital platforms that includes, but is not limited to:* Backend APIs for digital consumer products, eg: com & NHL App
* Front end experiences for NHL.com Gamecenter, Scoreboards, Stats/Advanced Stats, Schedules, Standings, Rosters, Player & Puck Tracking, etc.
* Tight collaboration with NHL App team on native Stats/Data surfaces & experiences within the app


You will contribute key input for roadmap planning and big-picture strategy, reporting directly to **VP, Digital Platforms**.  

You must be a forward-thinking, innovative hockey expert, comfortable working amidst and through uncertainty, able to ask the tough questions to ensure we build the right thing, and build the thing right.  

This is a unique opportunity to make an important impact on NHL’s business objectives, while deepening the relationship between NHL and its global fanbase in a rapidly growing and transforming industry.  

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES*** Execute on a roadmap and vision by converting abstract ideas into actionable steps and realistic deliverables for your scrum teams
* Document and work with product leadership to prioritize a backlog with epics and user stories accompanied by detailed acceptance criteria
* Lead Agile scrum team(s), forecast timelines, plan releases and coordinate cross-team deliverables within a complex technical ecosystem
* Champion data-driven decision making, and develop best practices
* Create alignment between engineering, business stakeholders and leadership. Be the first point of contact for questions and clarifications on your portfolio of products and projects
* Create transparency and accountability with mechanisms to compile status, identify risks and escalate critical product decisions and information
* Work with UX/Research to interview, analyze, observe and learn about your audience to create insights that will shape requirements, features and the product roadmap
* Use analytics and data to measure product performance, ROI and drive product prioritization and design decisions
* Be a subject matter expert on the product, platform and industry trends, gaining a deep understanding of customer motivations, problems, journeys, and usage patterns
* Partner with engineering, user experience, and research teams to constantly experiment and design product solutions that incorporate user feedback through multiple iterations
* Drive ideas forward from inception through execution, getting deeply embedded in the details and bridging the gaps where necessary to achieve target outcomes
* Lead by example in creating a work environment where we lift each other up and push each other towards our collective success
* Keep a pulse on the sports, media, and entertainment best practices and trends, to create best-in-class products and digital experiences

  

**QUALIFICATIONS**  

**Knowledge Areas/Experience****Required*** 7-10+ years Product Management experience in the sports or data space
* 5+ years of experience working with a major sports league or in sports media
* Expert-level knowledge of hockey, its statistics, rules, history and culture
* CSPO, PSPO or similar certification, or equivalent experience working with scrum teams in an agile or modified agile framework
* Experience shipping data-rich consumer experiences
* A rich understanding of software engineering ecosystems and related technologies such as REST APIs, oAuth, JSON, and user interface libraries (React)
* An ability to translate technical requirements and specifications into easily understood business concepts and vice versa
* Can show a strong portfolio of shipped products that show a data-inspired strategy and analytics influenced decision making
* Experience working with design, engineering, and QA teams using agile methodologies
* Experience developing requirement documents, user stories, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and user interaction diagrams
* Experience in conducting user-research and applying those findings to support data-informed decision-making

**Required Skills*** Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with a proven track record of working effectively with cross-functional teams
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate insights into actionable product strategies

  

**CORE COMPETENCIES**  

These core competencies reflect the underlying values that are necessary to represent the National Hockey League:* *Accountability*
* *Adaptability*
* *Communication*
* *Critical Thinking*
* *Inclusion*
* *Professionalism*
* *Teamwork & Collaboration*

  

**The NHL offers U.S. regular, full-time employees:****Time to Recharge**: Utilize our generous Paid Time Off (PTO) to focus on your well-being and ensure a healthy work/life balance. PTO includes paid holidays, vacation, personal and sick days, plus an extra day off for your birthday.**Ability to Focus on your Health:** Along with competitive salaries, the NHL offers comprehensive health benefits to employees and their eligible dependents effective on their first day with us – there is no waiting period. The NHL subsidizes a large portion of the health benefits costs, therefore your cost for medical, dental and vision coverage is minimal.
We also offer our employees and members of their household access to our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to support mental, physical, and financial health. In addition, employees have access to a digital wellness resource designed to improve health and happiness through courses in sleep, movement, and focus. These services are confidential and at no-cost to our employees.**Childcare Leave:** Because your family is the NHL family, employees are offered comprehensive Childcare Leave to welcome your new addition. The primary caregiver to the child is entitled to up to 12 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.

Employees that are not the primary caregiver to the child are entitled to up to 6 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, which must be taken within the first 6 months following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.**Confidence in your Retirement Goals:** Participate in the NHL’s Savings Plan which includes a 401K(pre-tax and Roth options) plus non-elective (employer) contributions to keep your retirement goals on track.**A Hybrid Work Schedule**: The NHL recognizes the value of flexibility in work locations/schedules to help our employees balance work/life priorities. Hybrid work schedules are available for a majority of our roles.**Our New Headquarters:** Our new, state of the art, offices are located at One Manhattan West in Hudson Yards. When you’re in the office, you can conduct meetings in one of our high-tech conference rooms, have lunch with a view or play in the game room. Employees can also enjoy New York’s newest neighborhood that is home to more than 100 shops, culinary experiences, and public artwork.**A Savings for Commuting:** Participate in the NHL’s pre-tax commuter benefit plan whichhelps offset the financial cost of traveling to and from our office.**NHL Partner Rates:** Unlock exclusive pricing from our Partners that include savings on travel, consumer goods and services, plus the NHL Store.**Life at the NHL:** In your first few days, you meet with your new teammates and the HR Team. You have the opportunity to learn more about the NHL and our workplace culture. Employees are invited to play hockey during our Tuesday Night Skate at Chelsea Piers, join our Employee Resource Groups and more. You are a part of our team and we encourage you to be your authentic self, adding to our dynamic workplace culture.**SALARY RANGE:**
 $150-190K

Actual base pay for a successful candidate will be determined based on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to: experience/training, market demands, and geographic location.**When applying, please be sure to include a cover letter with your salary expectations for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. NO EMAILS OR PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

These services are confidential and at no-cost to our employees.**Childcare Leave:** Because your family is the NHL family, employees are offered comprehensive Childcare Leave to welcome your new addition. The primary caregiver to the child is entitled to up to 12 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.

Employees that are not the primary caregiver to the child are entitled to up to 6 weeks of paid Childcare Leave, at full pay, which must be taken within the first 6 months following the birth, adoption, or placement of a child.**Confidence in your Retirement Goals:** Participate in the NHL’s Savings Plan which includes a 401K(pre-tax and Roth options) plus non-elective (employer) contributions to keep your retirement goals on track.**A Hybrid Work Schedule**: The NHL recognizes the value of flexibility in work locations/schedules to help our employees balance work/life priorities. Hybrid work schedules are available for a majority of our roles.**Our New Headquarters:** Our new, state of the art, offices are located at One Manhattan West in Hudson Yards. When you’re in the office, you can conduct meetings in one of our high-tech conference rooms, have lunch with a view or play in the game room. Employees can also enjoy New York’s newest neighborhood that is home to more than 100 shops, culinary experiences, and public artwork.**A Savings for Commuting:** Participate in the NHL’s pre-tax commuter benefit plan whichhelps offset the financial cost of traveling to and from our office.**NHL Partner Rates:** Unlock exclusive pricing from our Partners that include savings on travel, consumer goods and services, plus the NHL Store.**Life at the NHL:** In your first few days, you meet with your new teammates and the HR Team. You have the opportunity to learn more about the NHL and our workplace culture. Employees are invited to play hockey during our Tuesday Night Skate at Chelsea Piers, join our Employee Resource Groups and more. You are a part of our team and we encourage you to be your authentic self, adding to our dynamic workplace culture.**SALARY RANGE:**
 $100-120K

Actual base pay for a successful candidate will be determined based on a variety of job-related factors, including but not limited to: experience/training, market demands, and geographic location.**When applying, please be sure to include a cover letter with your salary expectations for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in this opportunity, however only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. NO EMAILS OR PHONE CALLS PLEASE.**

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

title: Floor Manager at French Roast
description:
Are you passionate about the restaurant industry and looking for an exciting new opportunity? French Roast, a beloved staple in the Upper West Side community for over 30 years, is seeking a dedicated and dynamic Floor Manager to join our team.

About Us:  
French Roast has been the go-to rendezvous spot for our neighbors, offering a warm and welcoming atmosphere along with delicious French cuisine. We pride ourselves on our strong community ties and exceptional service.

Responsibilities:  
- Oversee daily operations to ensure smooth and efficient service  
- Manage and support front-of-house staff, including scheduling and training  
- Maintain high standards of customer service and address any issues promptly  
- Collaborate with the kitchen team to ensure timely and accurate order delivery  
- Monitor inventory levels and assist with ordering supplies  
- Uphold health and safety regulations

Qualifications:  
- Previous experience in a managerial role within the restaurant industry  
- Strong leadership and communication skills  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  
- Excellent problem-solving abilities  
- A passion for hospitality and customer service

Why Join Us?  
- Be part of a well-established and respected restaurant  
- Work in a friendly and supportive environment  
- Opportunities for growth and development within the company  
- Competitive salary, and benefits

If you are ready to take the next step in your career and become a key player in our team, we would love to hear from you!

Application Question(s):

* A client is upset about a service delay. He's speaking loudly and attracting attention.

What would you do?  
A. Acknowledge his feelings and explain how you'll try to speed things up  
B. Politely ask him to calm down and explain that getting upset won't help speed things up  
C. Explain that all clients are equally important and you're doing your best  
D. Suggest he contact the customer service hotline  
E. Direct him to speak to your supervisor

* A guest leaves a very positive, detailed online review about their experience at your hotel.

What would you do?  
A. Reply publicly thanking the customer and mention an upcoming promotion  
B. Reply and publicly offer a discount for a future stay  
C. Create a broadly applicable thank you message that you can send to all positive reviewers  
D. No response is required; focus on responding to any negative feedback

* Which practices are critical to ensuring food safety in a restaurant kitchen? Select all that apply.

A. Regularly calibrating the thermometers used to check food temperatures  
B. Implementing a first-in, first-out system for all food items in storage  
C. Regularly retraining kitchen staff on cross-contamination prevention  
D. Allowing cooked foods to cool at room temperature before refrigeration to minimize temperature shock  
E. Issuing reusable gloves for food handlers to wear at all times
