title: Customer Experience Specialist (part-time, temporary contract)
description:
Adobe Portfolio is seeking a Customer Experience Specialist to join our unique team within Adobe.

As a part of the Adobe family, we're crafting the future of creative workflow. Our talented team of designers, developers, and community managers work hand-in-hand to create products that connect and empower the creative world.

The Customer Experience Specialist will be working with our Customer Experience Lead to answer questions and help our users feel supported and empowered to use our product. You will also identify problems and ensure all areas of Adobe Portfolio are running smoothly by working with our development team.

We strive to provide the best user experience to our members, and the CX team is our most important tool for collecting feedback on how our members use Adobe Portfolio - then using this to improve our products and overall experience.

**\\*\\* As a part-time Customer Experience Specialist you will work remotely between 20-25 hours per week. This position is a 6-month contract.**

**Responsibilities**

* Working with our Customer Experience Lead to provide product support to our community
* Balancing a high number of support tickets while prioritizing the most urgent questions
* Being a “bug detective,” and identifying what problems need to be escalated for fixing to help Adobe Portfolio run perfectly
* Identifying trends in feedback from users and suggesting product improvements
* Communicating any customer feedback and bugs with Customer Experience Lead

**Experience**

* Experience in customer service, ideally in a customer support role
* Kind, helpful, empathetic, and adaptable to an ever changing environment.
* Attention to detail to help identify, troubleshoot, and report bugs.
* Strong problem solving skills.
* Ability to determine customer needs and provide appropriate solutions.
* Savvy with online and mobile applications.
* Understanding of Mac systems, Google Docs.
* Fluent English speaking proficiency.

**Bonus** : Slack, Jira, ZenDesk, experience supporting an online community, a current Behance/Portfolio user, a creative professional or interest in the creative community

**More about this contract role**

* **As a part-time customer Experience Specialist you will work remotely between 20- 25 hours per week –– weekdays and occasional holidays. This position is a 6-month contract.**
* This is a temporary contract position at Adobe. As such, the contractor who fills this role will be employed by our staffing partner (Magnit).
* All interviews will be scheduled and conducted by the hiring manager. When a candidate has been selected, Magnit will extend the offer and provide assignment details including duration, benefits options and onboarding details.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract

Pay: $25.00 - $27.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Work from home

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Location:

* New York, NY (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Activity Specialist - Gerard Carter Center
description:
**Salary: $17.00 - $20.00 Hourly**  

  

The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  

  

To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  

  

The Staten Island - South Shore YMCA is seeking an Activity Specialist who will be responsible for providing a safe and positive environment for children, and provide opportunities for learning, interaction, and personal growth. The Activity Specialist will play a critical role in providing academic enhancement and enrichment in the Youth programs. The Activity Specialist will prepare and provide age-appropriate activities and instruction in physical, cultural, and enrichment activities.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of participants in the program by providing appropriate supervision at all times.
* Plan and implement meaningful activities and special events that are age-appropriate, exciting, challenging, and values-based.
* Teach participants the fundamentals of healthy living and fitness, including activities that build their level of skill and confidence.
* Coordinate and present a culminating performance at the end of the program cycle, if applicable.
* Work cooperatively with professional staff, teachers, and other program and/or school staff.
* Promote an inclusive, welcoming, and respectful environment that embraces the diversity of all participants.
* Create and maintain a strength-based, youth-focused atmosphere that is consistent and sensitive to the needs of participants with learning, emotional, or behavioral differences.
* Maintain accurate program documentation (sign-in/out forms, behavior reports, and incident reports, as appropriate).
* Serve as a positive role model for participants.
* Work with the Youth & Family Director to secure and maintain all equipment or supplies needed for the program activities.
* Understand and communicate the YMCA’s core values and the goals of the Program to participants and caregivers.
* Develop and maintain positive relationships with parents and caregivers by regularly communicating about their child’s strengths and areas for growth.
* Prepare the learning environment, lessons, and necessary supplies for the program activities.
* Actively participate in training sessions, designated meetings, and special events.
* Adhere to all Department of Health, YMCA of Greater New York, and funder standards, expectations, and regulations.

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

* High School diploma or equivalent required. College credits and formal education preferred.
* Minimum of two (2) years of experience working with youth, specifically working with children and planning activities in a group setting.
* Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Access, Adobe PageMaker, and Photoshop preferred.
* Strong interpersonal skills, leadership qualities, and comfortable with working with diverse youth and adults.

 **Benefits:**  

The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  

  

**How to Apply:**  

If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  

  

If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.

title: Patient Care Concierge
description:
**About Us**

At Apex Heart and Vascular, we provide cutting-edge compassionate care. We have a talented team who is proud to be making a positive impact on the lives of our patients each and every day. We are growing fast and looking to have an enthusiastic Patient Care Concierge to join our team.

**Role Description**

This is a full-time role for a Patient Care Concierge at Apex Heart and Vascular Center. The Patient Care Concierge will be responsible for ensuring a positive patient experience by managing online reviews, conducting feedback surveys, and providing exceptional customer service. The role involves interacting with patients to gather feedback, managing online reviews, and facilitating communication between patients and healthcare providers.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package commensurate with experience.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Greet and assist patients and families with check-in/check-out processes.
* Address patient concerns and provide information about services.
* Encourage and manage patient reviews on Google.
* Respond to reviews and resolve issues to improve patient satisfaction.
* Develop and manage patient feedback surveys.
* Collect and analyze survey data to identify areas for improvement.
* Deliver exceptional service with empathy and professionalism.
* Respond promptly to patient inquiries and requests.
* Serve as the main contact for patients and families.
* Maintain accurate patient records and ensure confidentiality.

**Qualifications**

* Strong communication skills
* Effective relationship-building abilities
* Experience in customer service
* Proficiency in managing online reviews and conducting surveys
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Knowledge of healthcare terminology and procedures is a plus
* High school diploma or equivalent required; associate's or bachelor's degree in hospitality, or a related field preferred

To be considered for this position, along with the LinkedIn application - please submit your CV along with a brief video recording (under 2 minutes) that includes:

* An introduction of yourself
* A summary of your relevant experience
* An explanation of why you are the right fit for this role

Send your CV and video to: support@apexheartandvascular.com

title: Sales Development Representative (SDR) Marketing Associate
description:
**Company Description**  

Leap Consulting Group is focused on helping business and technology leaders develop new ideas and solve their toughest challenges. We provide innovative and practical advice & tangible solutions in people, process, and platform to solve today's needs and prepare for tomorrow's opportunities. The growth area of this particular opportunity and several others are focused on our multi-specialty, rare disorders/genetics, and oncology laboratory client base.

 **Job Description** **Location:** Hybrid (Remote & On-Site in [Location])

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Sales Development Representative (SDR) Marketing Associate to join our team on a part-time basis. This hybrid role offers the flexibility of remote work combined with the opportunity to work on-site, providing valuable experience in both marketing and sales within a forward-thinking consulting firm.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Lead Generation:** Identify and research potential clients using various online tools and databases. Generate high-quality leads to support our sales and marketing teams.
* **Outreach and Engagement:** Conduct outreach to potential leads via email, phone, and social media to generate interest and set up initial meetings or calls.
* **Market Research:** Assist in analyzing market trends, competitor strategies, and customer needs to help refine marketing strategies and sales tactics.
* **Data Management:** Maintain and update CRM systems with accurate lead information and track the progress of outreach efforts.
* **Campaign Support:** Collaborate with the marketing team to assist in the development and execution of marketing campaigns, including content creation and performance tracking.
* **Reporting:** Prepare regular reports on lead generation activities, outreach success, and market insights to provide actionable feedback and support decision-making.

**What We Offer:**

* **Flexible Hours:** Part-time position with flexible working hours to accommodate academic schedules.
* **Hybrid Work Environment:** Blend of remote work and on-site presence, offering a balanced work-life experience.
* **Professional Growth:** Opportunities for learning and development within a supportive and innovative team environment.
* **Compensation:** Hourly rate commensurate with experience and skills.

 **Qualifications*** **Education:** BA/BS or upper-class student pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business, Quantitative Analysis, or a related field with a strong commercial interest.
* **Skills:** Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Proficiency in using CRM systems such as Pipedrive, sourcing products such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, and Apollo, Microsoft Office and Google Office Suites, and social media platforms.
* **Experience:** Previous experience in sales, marketing, or customer service is a plus but not required. A strong interest in marketing and sales is essential. Consulting exposure a plus.
* **Attributes:** Highly organized, self-motivated, and capable of working independently and as part of a team. Strong analytical skills with an ability to handle data and derive insights.

 **Additional Information**  

* Be comfortable communicating in-person, by phone, over video, as well as collaboration chat tools such as Slack
* Be a self-starting independent team player who is both professional and kind to colleagues and customers
* Be tech savvy and ideally consider yourself 'fairly technical'


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Marketing Associate
description:
**Join Our Marketing Team at Oakland Spine & Physical Therapy!**

Are you passionate about marketing and looking for a role where your creativity and enthusiasm can truly shine? Oakland Spine & Physical Therapy is on the hunt for a vibrant individual to become a key player in our marketing team. If you’re eager to bring your fresh ideas to the table and help us connect with our community, we’d love to meet you!

**What You'll Be Doing:**

* **Dream Big:** Brainstorm and develop creative marketing campaigns that captivate and engage our audience.
* **Get Hands-On:** Dive into various marketing activities, from crafting compelling content to planning exciting events.
* **Partner Up:** Work with external vendors to bring promotional events and campaigns to life.
* **Create & Innovate:** Design marketing materials using Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Mailchimp, and other tools.
* **Collaborate:** Team up with marketing and other professionals to enhance our brand and marketing efforts.
* **Reach Out:** Execute initiatives through social media, email, and mailers to connect with our audience.
* **Analyze & Improve:** Review marketing data to refine our strategies and ensure we’re on the right track.
* **Own It:** Tackle individual marketing tasks and contribute to our team’s success.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* **Tool Mastery:** Proficiency with Canva, Mailchimp, and Adobe is essential.
* **Eager Learner:** Experience with marketing data analytics is a plus, but a strong desire to learn is key.
* **Tech-Savvy:** Solid computer skills, including MS Office and design programs.
* **Detail-Oriented:** Highly organized and responsive, with a knack for staying on top of tasks.
* **Communicator:** Exceptional writing and communication skills that make your ideas come to life.
* **Creative Spirit:** A blend of commercial awareness and creative thinking.
* **Educational Background:** A degree in marketing, communications, or a related field is preferred, but we’re happy to train the right person.

**What We Offer:**

* **Compensation:** Competitive salary, discussed during the interview, based on your experience.
* **Job Type:** Full-time
* **Pay Range:** $35,000 - $65,000 per year

At Oakland Spine & Physical Therapy, we’re more than just a workplace; we’re a community that values creativity, collaboration, and growth. If you’re excited to contribute to a team that makes a difference in people’s lives, apply today and help us shape the future of our marketing efforts!

title: High School Biology Teacher
description:
**Company Description**  

Uncommon Schools is a nonprofit network of high-performing, public charter schools providing an outstanding K-12 education in historically under-resourced communities. We have proudly built schools that reflect our student population, with more than 60% of our teachers and staff across our network identifying as a person of color. Uncommon currently manages 53 schools serving more than 20,000 students in five cities: Boston, Camden, New York City, Newark, and Rochester. We are proud that Uncommon graduates persist in and graduate from college at five times the rate of their peers nationally. We achieve this by offering strong academic, co-curricular, and social-emotional learning that prepares students for success in college and beyond.


North Star Academy currently manages fourteen schools in Newark, NJ serving students in grades K through 12. We believe in strong authentic relationships between teachers and students, supported by effective school systems and an engaging instructional model that enables students to flourish academically and personally. North Star Academy is NJ's #1 highest performing public charter school and has served Newark families for over 20 years.

 **Job Description**  

Uncommon High School Biology teachers inspire students to explore the living world and develop a passion for scientific inquiry. You'll guide students through a rigorous Biology curriculum, preparing them for Advanced Placement (AP) coursework and future STEM studies. At North Star Academy, we believe all students can achieve at the highest levels, and our teachers play a crucial role in making that happen.

**Responsibilities**

**1. Instruction**

* Teach a Biology curriculum that fosters critical thinking and prepares students for college-level coursework.
* Develop students' skills in scientific inquiry, including questioning, data analysis, and lab experimentation.
* Create a classroom environment where students feel comfortable asking questions and engaging in scientific discourse.
* Facilitate student-led discussions and activities that encourage evidence-based reasoning and argumentation.
* Guide students through interactive labs and projects that deepen their understanding of biological concepts.
* Work collaboratively with the Science department to set ambitious academic and engagement goals for all students.

**2. Data Analysis**

* You'll meet weekly with your principal and/or instructional coach to analyze and respond to trends in student work samples and assessments.
* You'll learn and implement strategies to differentiate instruction for all learners in your classroom.

**3. School Culture**

* You’ll build positive relationships with students to ensure they feel seen, loved, and heard.
* You’ll partner with students’ families to ensure appropriate resources are available to support their child's learning needs.
* You'll engage in practice-based professional development, mentorship, and coaching sessions.
* You'll participate in weekly, school-wide meetings to cultivate community, model our core values, and encourage student achievement.
* You'll partner with your grade level team to develop academic goals and practice instructional strategies.

  

**Qualifications**  

* A commitment to the mission of Uncommon Schools and investment in our vision for being an anti-racist organization
* A demonstrated commitment to supporting students’ social emotional and academic development
* An enthusiasm for collaborating with internal and external partners in the best interest of students
* A self-directed learner who solicits and implements feedback to improve outcomes and achieve objectives
* **Required Experience:**
	+ A demonstrated interest in impacting K-12 students in urban schools and communities (1-2 years experience preferred).
	+ Academic expertise in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or other related fields of study.
	+ Prior to the start of employment, you must have a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university. Teacher certification is not a prerequisite for consideration at Uncommon Schools in the state of NJ, but you do need to meet NJ state certification eligibility requirements (a final undergraduate or graduate cumulative GPA of 3.0 for graduates on or after 9/1/16, or 2.75 if you graduated prior to 9/1/16). All instructional staff are required to become certified in the state of New Jersey within a reasonable period after beginning employment.

  

**Additional Information** **Our people are what makes us Uncommon.** We believe our compensation philosophy and benefits should reflect our values—equity, transparency, and clarity—to enhance our ability to attract and retain talent and reward their expertise. Our staff receive best-in-class training, coaching, and support to develop and operate mission-driven schools that provide a high-quality education to our students and families.

**Compensation for this position:** The starting compensation for this role based in Newark is between $59,000 to $83,000. The starting pay will depend on various factors including but not limited to relevant professional experience, education, certifications, and tenure with Uncommon Schools. Because we value staff tenure in a role, we do not currently cap salary ranges for current staff members.

**Other Benefits:**

* Generous paid time off inclusive of sick time and school breaks (spring, winter, and summer) + additional sustainability half days throughout the school year
* Extensive, best-in-class training and development
* Choice of 3 comprehensive health insurance plans
* Pre-tax flexible spending and health saving accounts
* Financial planning & wellness
	+ New Jersey Pension program
	+ 529 college savings program
	+ Public Service Loan Forgiveness application assistance
	+ Financial planning tools and assistance
* Dependent Care FSA, back up childcare and daycare discounts
* Paid leave of absence
	+ Fully paid parental leave
	+ Fully paid medical leave
	+ Additional paid Short Term and Long Term Disability insurance
* Mental health and counseling support + wellness benefits


Uncommon believes in the importance of being a diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization that enables our students and staff to thrive. We are committed to building an exceptional team that reflects the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our students. We also strive to ensure an inclusive community by creating a space for meaningful dialogue about issues of race and identity for our staff and students. As an equal opportunity employer, Uncommon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. We also ensure that individuals with disabilities receive all privileges and benefits associated with employment and are provided reasonable accommodations for the interview process and to perform core job functions. If you would like to request an accommodation, please email recruitment@uncommonschools.org.

title: Content Creator
description:
Being a creative shouldn’t be lonely.

Spend your days doing what you love with people that understand.

**Apply for our Content Creator position.** 

**YossiG Design** 

**Luxury Residential and Commercial Interior Design** 

**Where do you spend the best hours of your day?** 

Work in a place that values you for you. That understands that you’re more than just the sum total of your talent. That has your best interest at heart. That acknowledges your needs, wants, preferences and feelings. A place that knows that as much as you love being an employee, you love being a person. You want to grow. You want to succeed. You want to be seen. You want to become. YossiG understands that, and encourages it. Nothing will hinder your path to success. Nothing will stall your journey to greatness.

We won’t own you, we’ll just loan you.

That’s us. Now, what about you?

**We’re looking for a Content Creator:** 

We’re looking for someone that is steeped in the world of social media. Someone that has social media handles or content creation tucked firmly under their belt with lots of room for more to join. Someone who understands that a brand is way more than a logo and creates strategies on how to bring the brand to life. Someone who sees the details in everything and absolutely loves getting creative. Someone who can switch off from filming to photoshop to caption creation like it’s nobody’s business. Someone who loves to work independently but also thrives as a team player. Someone with the backbone to make big decisions and the knowledge to back it up. Someone that has an eye for aesthetics and understands interior design terms and trends. Someone that wants a career yet wants to be part of something bigger than themselves.

Someone with a strong past and an even stronger future.

If you crossed the line from starry eyed creative to established professional, reach out.

And don’t let our high expectations deter you.

We’re human too.

**Why does YossiG exist?** 

Our Mission is to design spaces that inspire the best in people.

**Our team is united by the following five core values:** 

All ears; no airs

Assume you know nothing. Take the time to listen, connect, and hear the unspoken. With no airs, it’s always people first.

Keep growing

Seek more—more skills, more knowledge, more growth. Challenge the status quo, reject mediocre, and never stop at good; push for great.

Sign your name.

Own it completely. Don’t just leave your mark, sign your name. Take responsibility, take initiative, take pride.

Surprise and delight

Dazzle by delivering the unexpected. Do that thing that will make eyes twinkle, smiles widen, and spirits soar.

See what others don’t

See around corners. Find solutions to problems clients didn’t know they had. Take the time to notice, innovate, and elevate.

**Role Overview:** The Content Creator is responsible for developing and managing content for the interior design firm’s Instagram page. This role involves following the established design direction, creating a monthly calendar of posts, crafting engaging posts, video and photo of posts, reels, stories and etc., capturing content live with the team and client, as well as managing the overall Instagram presence. The ideal candidate is a creative and detail-oriented individual with a strong understanding of social media trends and interior design aesthetics.

**Tasks and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 

* Content Creation:
* Develop visually appealing and engaging content that aligns with the firm’s design direction and brand identity.
* Produce high-quality images, videos, and graphics that showcase the firm's interior design projects, behind-the-scenes activities, and design tips.
* Write compelling captions and utilize relevant hashtags to increase post visibility and engagement.
* Content Planning:
* Create a monthly content calendar to plan and schedule posts in advance, ensuring a consistent posting schedule.
* Collaborate with the marketing team to align content with marketing campaigns, promotions, and events.
* Stay up-to-date with social media trends and interior design industry news to incorporate relevant and timely content.
* Instagram Management:
* Manage the Instagram account, including posting content, responding to comments and messages, and engaging with followers.
* Monitor and analyze performance metrics such as likes, comments, shares, and followers to optimize content strategy.
* Identify opportunities to increase engagement and grow the Instagram following.
* Brand Representation:
* Ensure all content reflects the firm’s brand voice, values, and aesthetic.
* Maintain a cohesive and visually appealing Instagram feed that attracts and retains followers.
* Engage with influencers, clients, and partners to enhance the firm’s online presence and reach.

**Qualifications:** 

* Proven experience as a content creator, social media manager, or similar role.
* Strong portfolio showcasing creativity, attention to detail, and proficiency in visual content creation.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficiency in graphic design tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite, Canva) and social media management tools.
* Familiarity with Instagram analytics and performance metrics.
* Knowledge of interior design trends and a keen eye for aesthetics.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
* Highly organized with excellent time management skills.

**Preferred Qualifications:** 

* Experience in the interior design industry.
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Graphic Design, or a related field.

**Salary Range:** $55,000.00 - $75,000.00\\* per year plus bonuses and benefits

\\*contingent on relevant experience

**Our Interview Process:** 

We interview with 3-5 meetings total in a span of 2-3 weeks. Our interview process is as follows:

* Initial Call with Marketing Director over Zoom
* In-Person Meeting with Marketing Director & Design Director
* In-Person Meeting to finalize details with Marketing Director

We are ready to start this process if you feel you would be a great fit. Let us know!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $55,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Social media marketing: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11237 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11237: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician
description:
**Pharmacy Technician Certified**

**Full Time | M-F & rotating weekend**

**THE BEST CAREERS.** RIGHT HERE

@ BROOKLYN’S LEADING HEALTHCARE SYSTEM**.**

**MAIMONIDES: TOP TEN IN THE U.S. FOR CLINICAL OUTCOMES**

We’re Maimonides Health, Brooklyn’s largest healthcare system, serving over 250,000 patients each year through the system’s 3 hospitals, 1800 physicians, more than 80 community-based practices and outpatient centers*. At Maimonides Health, our core values* ***H.E.A.R.T*** *drives everything we do. We uphold and maintain Honesty, Empathy, Accountability, Respect, and Teamwork to empower our talented team, engage our respective communities and provide patient-centered care.* The system is anchored by Maimonides Medical Center, one of the nation’s largest independent teaching hospitals and home to centers of excellence in numerous specialties; Maimonides Midwood Community Hospital (formerly New York Community Hospital), a 130-bed adult medical-surgical hospital; and Maimonides Children’s Hospital, Brooklyn’s only children’s hospital and only pediatric trauma center. Maimonides’ clinical programs rank among the best in the country for patient outcomes, including its Heart and Vascular Institute, Neurosciences Institute, Bone and Joint Center, and Cancer Center. Maimonides is an affiliate of Northwell Health and a major clinical training site for SUNY Downstate College of Medicine.

We are currently seeking a full time **Certified Pharmacy Technician** to join our team. We require

* **Associate's degree** (Bachelor’s preferred).
* **PTCB Certification**
* Completion of a technician certification program, certification as Pharmacy Technician by the National Technician Board (PTCB) with required continuing education credits to maintain certification, and a successful completion of department administered qualifying examination
* **NYS Registration for Technicians required**
* **6 months of experience in a pharmacy is required. Hospital experience preferred**.
* Good verbal communication and interpersonal skills a must.

We offer a competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package. **Salary: $30.59/hour.** Please send your resume with salary requirements to Yevgenia Bukher @ YBukher@maimo.org**.** EOE

title: Purchasing Agent
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Purchasing Agent to join our team. As a Purchasing Agent, you will play a crucial role in managing our supply chain and ensuring the timely procurement of goods and services. Your primary responsibility will be to negotiate with suppliers, analyze pricing, and maintain inventory levels. If you have a strong background in supply chain management and are skilled in sourcing and contract negotiation, we encourage you to apply.

**DUTIES:**

- Source and evaluate potential suppliers based on price, quality, and delivery speed  
- Negotiate contracts and terms with suppliers to ensure favorable pricing and terms  
- Monitor inventory levels and place orders as needed to maintain optimal stock levels  
- Collaborate with internal teams to understand their purchasing needs and requirements  
- Utilize MRP (Material Requirements Planning) systems to track inventory and manage purchasing activities  
- Conduct market research to identify new suppliers and stay up-to-date with industry trends  
- Maintain accurate records of purchases, pricing, and supplier information  
- Resolve any issues or disputes with suppliers in a timely manner

**Requirements**

- Proven experience as a Purchasing Agent or in a similar role  
- Strong knowledge of supply chain management principles and practices  
- Familiarity with MRP systems (e.g., Edwards, AS400) for inventory management  
- Excellent negotiation skills with the ability to secure favorable pricing and terms  
- Ability to analyze pricing data and make informed purchasing decisions  
- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills  
- Effective communication skills, both verbal and written  
- Ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines

If you are a motivated individual with a passion for procurement and supply chain management, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team as a Purchasing Agent!

title: Clinical Director (BCBA)
description:
**Clinical Director (BCBA) – ABA Centers of New Jersey**  
**Edison, NJ**

**About ABA Centers of New Jersey**

As New Jersey’s top ABA provider, we take it as our responsibility to bring the best autism therapy to as many families as possible. Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy is the gold standard in autism care. Our highly trained, certified professionals customize therapy programs to meet the goals of individuals with autism and their families. In addition to ABA therapy, we offer autism diagnostic testing in an effort to reduce or eliminate long waiting lists that can rob families of months of critical early intervention care.

**Leadership Opportunity**

Are you a BCBA interested in taking your career to the next level with a stable company where everyone’s voice is heard, and clinic decisions are made only by clinicians? We are changing the ABA field and expanding services to meet the growing demand. Help us make a new future.Our Clinical Director is responsible for monitoring the daily clinical operations of a single clinic location providing ABA therapy services. The Clinical Director ensures a clear line of communication between BCBAs, RBTs, and other team members.

**What You’ll Do**

* Manage BCBAs and RBTs to ensure clinical quality
* Supervise the daily implementation of behavior intervention, treatment plans, and client documentation
* Provide guidance to grow the clinical and professional skills of BCBAs
* Give direct verbal/written feedback to BCBAs and RBTs regarding clinical implementation, including modeling
* Conduct behavior and skill-based assessments and treatment plans for clients admitted into the region as needed
* Support BCBAs in extended assessment opportunities (FBA, FA, preference assessment, etc.)
* Meet weekly with BCBAs to review client progress
* Conduct on-site supervision of BCBAs and RBTs at service locations
* Make monthly check-in phone calls with families
* Support the ABA Academy of Excellence training program by analyzing regional IOA and treatment integrity data
* Develop (as a team) and oversee a clinic-based curriculum
* Collaborate with Regional Operations team
* Supervise unrestricted hours for BCBA Apprentices
* Travel for assessments, oversight of clinical team, and support for high-risk clients

**Education/Experience and Other Requirements**

* Master's degree in Applied Behavior Analysis
* BCBA certification
* LBA licensure for Tennessee
* 5 years of experience in the ABA field (preferred)
* Must maintain clean background/drug screenings and driving record

**Benefits**

* 15 days of PTO (increases with tenure by company policy)
* Medical, dental, vision, long-term disability, and life insurance
* Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA) options
* 401(k) program with generous employer match up to 6%
* Performance bonus potential

**ABA Centers of New Jersey Culture**

The ABA Centers of New Jersey team thrives on professionalism, respect, and a shared passion for helping people. Whether it’s coming together to create special events for kids with autism or collaborating with other therapy providers for the best possible outcome for a child, our people are dedicated to the families we serve. And as a company, we’re dedicated to creating a supportive, uplifting, and fun environment for our people.

title: Spanish Teacher for Kids (in-person, New York City)
description:
As a Spanish Teacher, you will help to create a well-structured, inclusive, and fun language learning environment for our young learners in grades Pre-K to 5th. You will use your experience, creativity, and passion for languages to create a place that is warm, positive, and organized, yet challenging and able to hold students accountable for their growth. Your teaching will be consistent with our mission, vision, and methodology. **Must be available to start the first week of September, Wednesdays-Fridays, 3-5 pm.**

Job Responsibilities:

* Teach 3-6 hours of classes weekly
* **Must be available to start the first week of September, Wednesdays-Fridays, 3-5 pm.**
* **Must be available to work in Brooklyn, NY.**
* Work closely with our Founder and other teachers to continuously improve relevant curricula
* Use assessment data, student work, and other information to inform plans for student and class objectives
* Use positive reinforcement and social learning strategies as your way of teaching
* Prioritize each student's academic and social environment
* Understand and work in accordance with our mission and vision

About You:

* Bachelor's degree required; master's degree in education strongly preferred
* Native-like level of proficiency in Spanish
* A deep understanding of Spanish-speaking cultures
* A deep belief in our mission and vision with a strong enthusiasm, passion, and energy
* A deep belief in community building and bonding to achieve results
* Authorized to work in the U.S.
* Preference will be given to teachers who have undergone fingerprinting for the DOE
* The critical features of this role are described above but are not all encompassing

About Us:

Diáfano is the language learning hub of the future, with human-centered philosophy at its very core. The Diáfano Method fuses tried and true methods of language learning with our own modern spin. Designed by a linguist and administered by a global community of top-tier native educators, our method hacks into the psychology of language learning to ensure maximum retention and true mastery.

Our Goal:

We empower people to immerse themselves in new cultures and create meaningful connections through language learning. We believe that language learning leads to cross-cultural understanding, so we aim to make it more accessible and more impactful than ever. Our goal is to help students achieve language mastery through methods focused on social learning. We rely on data to inform progress and our decision-making process, all while engaging in culturally-responsive pedagogy. As a teacher, your job is as much to teach about the language as it is to teach its cultural context and help to continue to build a culturally competent and understanding society.

Our Core Values:

* Mastery: We strive for mastery in everything that we do.
* Sincerity: Integrity means a lot to us. It is at the core of who we are.
* Innovation: We create our own rules to give you an experience and results you won’t find anywhere else.
* Inclusivity: We are driven to create classes that are culturally-relevant and driven. We believe in inclusivity from the teachers we hire to the courses we teach.
* Connection: We care about people, first and foremost. We always create a nurturing environment that supports bonding, connection, and growth.

We regret not being able to respond to all inquiries. No phone calls please.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience teaching children pre-K to 5th grade?
* Have you undergone fingerprinting for the DOE?

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

title: Partnerships Manager, Americas
description:
**The Role...**



We're looking for a calm, confident and charismatic individual. They will thrive with the demands of a rapidly growing and multi-faceted company gracefully, and handle multiple projects in a fast paced environment. The right candidate will have a fascination with brand & trends, and have a passion for the creative industries – film, design, fashion etc.



Main Duties:


* Project manage assigned Brand Partnerships end-to-end to ensure all contractual obligations are met and all elements remain on-brand for Soho House
* Be the main client liaison for brand partner and build a positive working relationship with the client and wider team
* Schedule and attend regular meetings with assigned brand partners to maintain relationships and plan forthcoming activity
* Identity new growth opportunities within the partnership to contribute to New Business target
* Liaise closely with various Soho House departments and teams including Content, Events and Marketing, to plan partnerships and ensure wider understanding on deliverables
* Manage on-going communications for brand partner
* Maintain an expert knowledge of all of our sites, from member needs, house spaces and facilities, comms channels inc. private social feeds and key staff
* Support with partnership admin, tracking, reporting and assist our partners on hospitality requests such as restaurant & rooms bookings
* Assist the team with finance and legal requirements such as contract and invoicing
* Responsible for tracking and collating all brand communications including event listings, content, photography, social
* Coordinate monthly reporting for assigned Brand Partnerships for the partner and business
* Manage P&L for assigned brand partnerships
* Visit sites to support teams, attend events, check placements and host partners
* Proactively surface ideas and trends, help brainstorm and identity new opportunities
* Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor/manager.


**Qualifications...**


* 6+ years agency, in-house or freelance marketing experience, either in a specific partnership / sponsorship role or with proven client experience
* The role requires a fast learner with strong project management, organizational skills, deadline driven and ability to multiple manage projects simultaneously
* Must have experience establishing and developing productive relationships with agency teams, brands, clients and suppliers
* Strong writing, presentation (keynote / powerpoint) and communication skills
* Firm understanding and experience with event curation and production
* Experience and understanding of managing budgets
* Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients and projects
* Proficiency in languages a bonus, but not a requirement

  


**Why Work With Us...**



Soho House offers competitive compensation packages that feature global benefits and perks. Whether you're seeking entry-level employment or a new opportunity to expand your profession, we offer training to develop the technical and managerial skills necessary to enhance your career.


* **Health Care + 401K**: Full time employees are eligible for full benefits; Medical, Dental & Vision as well as Retirement fund with a 2% match
* **Paid Time Off**: Full- Time Employees have sick day's + vacation days
* **Career Development:** Soho House can progress your career domestically or internationally as well as managerially or technically
* **Soho Impact**: Empowering the Soho House Community to make positive change, through mentoring, apprenticeship, local outreach and sustainability
* **Learning & Development**: An extensive range of internally and externally run courses are available for all employees.
* **Cookhouse & House Tonic:** Celebrating our passion for food and drink. Check out our monthly calendars and get involved in trips, training's and events. Available to all.
* **Team Events:** From fitness sessions to cinema screenings and art classes, each month we hold a series of fun events which you can sign up to.
* **Team Meal**: Whilst on duty in our Houses & Restaurants you will be provided with a substantial meal free of charge.

title: Behavior Technician (BT)/ASD, Registered Behavior Technician (RBT)/ASD
description:
**ABA Therapist**

The Social Spectrum Inc. is hiring self-motivated individuals that are open to building their leadership skills and working with children with autism.

At The Social Spectrum Inc., we offer both in-home, in-center, and community based ABA therapy for children from the age of 2 to 21. Our center is in Morganville, NJ, but we accept clients from all over the state of New Jersey, including Monmouth and Middlesex County. We believe that creating a happy and supportive place for a child to learn and grow starts with giving an employee the skills set and comfort of working in a place they love.

We offer flexible scheduling with afternoons, early evenings, and weekend availabilities. We provide on-the-job training in the latest skills in Applied Behavior Analysis as well as supervision for those who are pursuing their Registered Behavior Technician (RBT), Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA), or Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) credentials.

Under the supervision of a Board-Certified Behavior Analyst, therapists deliver 1:1 therapy to clients with specific treatment plans that address behavioral, community, daily living, and social skills.

**Required Experience**

- Minimum of High school diploma or equivalent

- Experience with children, preferably some experience with children with disabilities

- A valid driver’s license or reliable transportation to and from a session

- Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

- Must be able to meet the rigorous physical demands of the job which may include long periods of standing, sitting, following, pushing/pulling equipment, and/or lifting

**Benefits and Advantages**

- Competitive pay based on education, training, and experience

- Opportunity for pay increase upon quarterly review

- Team collaborative environment

- Supervision for those who are pursuing their Registered Behavior Technician (RBT), Board Certified assistant Behavior Analyst (BCaBA), or Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) credentials.

description:

FNP provides comprehensive evaluations and treats the adult substance abuse population, while also coordinating mental health services.

* Responsible for the management of chronic and acute illnesses.

* Respond to medical emergencies within the facility.

* Assure patients are referred to appropriate medical facilities when a higher level of care is needed.
* Collaborate patient care with other community providers.

title: Marketing and Operations Manager (French Speaking)
description:
Our bilingual Daycare/ Preschool, Petits Poussins Dumbo, part of the larger corporation, VHG Group Inc., is looking for a French speaking professional Marketing and Operations Manager (MOM) to promote, coordinate, and oversee our organization’s operations. Ideally, the MOM will also have experience in education and more precisely in early childhood. The MOM will have strong marketing and managerial skills. The specific duties of the MOM include formulating strategy, improving performance, procuring material and resources and securing compliance. As a new school in the Dumbo area, we are looking for someone with extensive community knowledge who knows how to make an impact and has the ability to attract new families to our center. As a manager, you should be ready to mentor your team members, find ways to maintain parent satisfaction and implement best practices across all levels. Ultimately, we’ll trust you to help us remain compliant, efficient and profitable during the course of business.

The MOM will have the ability to be flexible and handle different tasks as specified by school owner. The MOM will be able to adapt themself to the academic or administrative needs of the day. They will serve as a “right hand” to the school owner, by taking initiatives and working independently. They will have strong communicative skills and will be able to have conversations with school parents in French or in English. They will ensure that children and family's needs are met in addition to company standards and expectations.

**Duties of a Marketing and Operations Manager**

A Marketing and Operations Manager plays a crucial role in ensuring that marketing strategies are effectively executed while optimizing operational processes. Here’s a detailed breakdown of their key duties:

* **Strategic Planning and Execution**
* Develop and implement marketing strategies to enhance student enrollment.
* Coordinate marketing campaigns across various channels to maximize reach and effectiveness which in turn lead to increased student enrollment.
* **Performance Measurement**
* Monitor and analyze, with our social media coordinator, marketing performance metrics to assess the effectiveness of campaigns.
* Prepare reports on campaign outcomes, providing insights for future strategies.
* **Process Optimization**
* Identify inefficiencies in current marketing operations and implement improvements.
* Design scalable processes that enhance team productivity and collaboration.
* **Budget Management**
* Manage the marketing budget, ensuring resources are allocated efficiently.
* Track spending against budget forecasts to maintain financial control.
* **Team Leadership**
* Recruit, train, and mentor staff to build a high-performing team.
* Set clear objectives for team members and conduct regular performance reviews along with Education Director.
* **Collaboration with Cross-Functional Teams**
* Work closely with VHG group managers to ensure alignment on goals.
* Facilitate communication between departments and other teams to support integrated marketing efforts.
* **Customer Insights and Market Research**
* Conduct market research to understand customer needs and preferences.
* Analyze competitive landscape to inform strategic decisions.

By fulfilling these duties, a Marketing and Operations Manager ensures that both the marketing initiatives are effective in driving business growth while maintaining operational efficiency within the organization.

**SKILLS AND ABILITIES**

· Take initiatives

· Strong customer relations skills

· Pro-active leadership skills

· Strong communication and organizational skills

· Effective time management skills

· Self-starter with a strong work ethic

· Ability to multi-task, to be flexible

· Strong sales and marketing skills

· Full knowledge of Microsoft Office: Word, Power Point, Excel

· Maintain Confidentiality and only discuss sensitive information with President of the company

**Day to Day RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Ongoing research on products and services that may benefit the school administration

· New project development and monitoring

· Help with teacher recruitment

· Help with staff professional development: research on targeted PD and implementation of PD

· Supervise administrators and teachers at assigned location(s)

· Help with trademark filing and follow up

· Help with Compliance with current governmental regulations as directed by supervisor

· Must meet company procedures, policies, and reports

· Budget planning, compliance and cost control as directed by supervisor

· Strategic planning as directed by supervisor

· Inventory management, software research to optimize budget

· Facility and classroom maintenance supervision

· School public relations

· Maintain school files

· Maintain overall quality of excellence and professionalism

· Maximize enrollment

· Marketing

· Curriculum development and planning

· Help develop and create evaluation tools and how to give feedback to teachers

· Create Payroll reports

· Run fire drills: Must pass both S95 and F-07 exams

Work hours: 3 days 8-4pm and 2 days 8-6PM

Years of experience in marketing: 3 years+

Languages: French and English

Start Compensation: $70,000 +

Benefits: Health, Dental, 401K, PTO (Up to 45 days)

title: RN Care Manager - Spanish Speaking
description:
***RN Care Manger***

General Purpose/Scope:

Salary: $85,000 to $95,000

Under the direction of the Care Management Supervisor, the Care Manager is responsible for ongoing assessment of health, environmental, and psychosocial status of members assigned to him/her, six (6) month reassessments using the designated New York State Assessment tool, other plan assessment tools, and ongoing care management of members through telephonic contact.

***Responsibilities of the Care Manager***

* Provides care management including care planning, coordination, and assessment of health, environmental, and psycho-social status members on an ongoing basis. These assessments will be conducted in telephonically;
* Monitoring services for quality, effectiveness, and progress toward goals;
* Coordination of transitions including discharge planning from the hospital or nursing home;
* Identifies health, environmental, and psycho-social risks for assigned members and recommends appropriate interventions to the Interdisciplinary Care team;
* Provides ongoing assessment of the effectiveness of the Member's plan of care and discusses and develops a comprehensive Plan of Care in collaboration with the member, family, physician, and other interdisciplinary team members as appropriate by assessing and identifying the clinical, psycho-social and financial needs of the patient/family caregivers. Establish mutually agreed upon goals utilizing evidence based guidelines as available;
* Reviewed member requests for services and supplies, using clinical criteria and provides rational for decision based on clinical criteria, in collaboration with Care Management Supervisor and IDT;
* Conducts semiannual reassessments using New York State assessment tool and other plan defined assessment tools;
* Coordinates services that are covered and not covered to create a comprehensive care plan that meets the medical, psycho-social and financial needs of the member;
* Requests disease management and condition specific plans for member’s primary care practitioners and helps facilitate implementation.
* Implements disease management protocols as directed by the Care Management Supervisor and Patient Services Manager;
* Works collaboratively with the Interdisciplinary Care Team;
* Documents care management;
* Performs other job-related duties as may be required or directed by the supervisor.

***Requirements:***

**Language:**

The Care Manager will need to be able to speak Spanish

**RN License:**

The Care Manager's license will need to be New York endorsed.

**Experience:**

Experience in Managed Care, Home Care or Community setting is strongly preferred.

**Core Competencies:**

*Customer Focus/Cultural Awareness:* You are a team member who understands the importance of strong customer service internally and externally.

title: Floater Teacher
description:
**If you want to take part in shaping the future, creating an environment to thrive, and fulfilling life purpose, then this is the place for you!**

**What it's like working at Orchard:** Working at Orchard School means being part of a community. You become a teacher who is deeply invested in your students’ success, and, likewise, you are in an environment of educators who are deeply invested in you. Since the Orchard School is family-owned and operated, it has an atmosphere of intimacy that allows students and teachers to grow in an environment where they’re cared about and understood.

Teachers and administrators work side-by-side to ensure the health, safety, wellbeing, and learning of our students and their futures; after all, working in Early Childhood Education means your hands are directly involved in helping to shape the future. The Orchard School takes this endeavor very seriously, and so seeks team members who want to be active participants in making a change in the world. The Orchard School is a place full of growth.

Our students are growing, our teachers are growing, and even our school itself is growing as we discover and nurture the kind of environment that we can be proud of. At the end of the day, we are looking for teachers who are excited to grow with us to help us be a powerful force in the lives of our students and their families.

**As a Floater Teacher, you will:**

* **Nurture and Support:** Provide primary and secondary caregiving across various age groups, including infants, toddlers, and older toddlers, fostering a secure and nurturing environment for all children.
* **Engage in Play and Development:** Actively participate in play, dance, and developmental activities, supporting Lead Teachers in guiding each child's growth and learning.
* **Prepare and Serve Meals:** Oversee the preparation and serving of morning snacks, lunch, and afternoon snacks, ensuring that all children receive nutritious and balanced meals.
* **Facilitate Nap Time:** Assist children in transitioning to nap time, creating a calm and soothing atmosphere that promotes restful sleep.
* **Support Classroom Activities:** Contribute to classroom activities and child-led play, enhancing the learning experience and fostering creativity.
* **Coordinate Arts & Crafts:** Prepare and organize pre-established arts and crafts activities throughout the week, ensuring materials are ready and accessible.
* **Maintain Hygiene and Schedules:** Support and adhere to potty training and diaper changing routines, ensuring each child's health and comfort.
* **Uphold Center Cleanliness:** Assist in maintaining the cleanliness and upkeep of the center, including tasks such as laundry, dishes, sanitation, and restocking supplies.
* **Build Parent Relationships:** Establish strong, positive relationships with parents through clear and consistent communication, keeping them informed of their child's progress.
* **Ensure Compliance:** Adhere to all regulations and guidelines for children's care, health, and safety, maintaining a safe and compliant environment.
* **Foster a Collaborative Environment:** Contribute to a positive and engaging work environment through collaboration with colleagues and continuous learning.

**Benefits:**

* No weekends
* $300 Sign-On Bonus
* Employee Discount
* Professional Development Assistance
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Childcare Discounts
* Paid Training for CPR, First Aid, and CDA

**Skills, Abilities, and Experience we are looking for:**

* Experience in early childcare
* Organization, time management, and multi-tasking skills
* Oral and written communication skills

**Why work for The Orchard School?**

When you join The Orchard School, you're not just becoming part of a team – you're immersing yourself in a dynamic community that evolves daily, constantly reaching for higher levels dedicated to the success of children.

As leaders in early childhood education and integral co-creators of our teaching team, you personify the core values of The Orchard School. To foster an environment that is not only joyful and dynamic but also relaxed, welcoming, and creatively inspiring, allowing our children to express themselves and engage with their surroundings in unique ways, your presence brings stability to the lives of infants, toddlers, preschoolers, and pre-k children.

A mentality characterized by flexibility, presence, excitement, patience, dedication, and a collaborative spirit cultivates our team of educators. We are deeply committed to excellence and thrive through working together.

Beyond being a Preschool, The Orchard School allows teachers to inspire young minds through our innovative early childhood education curriculum. Our passionate teachers are excited to educate, adore children, and infuse joy into learning.

Whether it's dressing up for holidays or being the silliest teacher in the world, we create an atmosphere where learning is not just encouraged but celebrated. Join The Orchard School, where every day brings new opportunities to inspire and make a lasting impact on young hearts and minds.

Sounds like you, apply now!

title: Fabrication Shop Manager
description:
**Job Summary:** The Fabrication Shop Manager is responsible for managing daily operations within the fabrication shop. This includes ensuring that all tasks are completed on schedule and to the required quality standards, maintaining a safe working environment, and overseeing a team of mechanics. The Fabrication Shop Manager is accountable for adherence to company policies, including attendance and timekeeping, and plays a critical role in training and guiding employees to enhance their skills and productivity.

**Duties and Essential Job Functions:**

**Daily Management:**

* Set daily objectives for saw operators, finishers, and helpers, and communicate these goals to the team.
* Address any quality issues promptly and effectively.
* Ensure the shop is clean and organized, with materials properly stored and walkways clear of obstructions.
* Monitor and maintain equipment, coordinating maintenance and repairs as needed.
* Meet customer and company QA/QC requirements.

**Team Supervision and Development:**

* Provide guidance and training to new and existing employees to maintain high standards of craftsmanship and quality.
* Ensure adherence to company attendance policies and accurate timekeeping.
* Evaluate crew competencies and provide additional training or resources as needed.
* Monitor crew performance and administer discipline as required.

**Safety and Compliance:**

* Enforce safety policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with OSHA and other safety regulations.
* Report all safety incidents to President/Vice President in a timely manner.
* Foster a culture of safety within the shop and ensure the team adheres to required safety standards.
* Provide safety training and actively manage job safety.
* Knowledge of applicable safety regulations and customer safety requirements.
* Foster a culture of safety and take necessary action to prevent incidents.

**Communication and Continuous Improvement:**

* Solicit employee feedback on continuous improvement ideas.
* Communicate expectations and results at daily meetings.
* Review project plans with the Project manager and provide feedback for improvement.
* Effective problem-solving skills and ability to handle unexpected conditions with minimal oversight.
* Demonstrate effective communication with crew members and coordination with project managers and superintendents.

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or equivalent certification.
* Thorough knowledge of safety requirements and regulations.
* Strong organizational and leadership skills.
* Ability to effectively manage and motivate a team.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
* Ability to work on tight timelines while maintaining high-quality standards.
* Customer-oriented with a positive attitude and strong work ethic.

**Additional Attributes:**

* Self-starter with a strong desire to succeed.
* Honesty and integrity
* Ability to work with a diverse group of people and maintain cooperative team relationships.

The Fabrication Shop Manager is crucial in ensuring that projects are completed safely, on time, and to the highest quality standards. This role requires a combination of leadership, technical expertise, and strong organizational skills.

title: Strategy & Operations Business Partner - Professional Services
description:
Beacon Platform was founded in 2014 by Kirat Singh and Mark Higgins, industry leaders in building and designing enterprise-scale trading, analytics, and risk management platforms. Our products enable financial institutions of all sizes to operationalize front-office development at enterprise scale on the cloud. The Platform consists of Beacon Front Office Suite for cross-asset management of trades, positions and risk, and Beacon Core, an integrated development and operating platform that enables quants and software engineers to collaboratively develop and continuously deploy business solutions. Beacon's open architecture and transparent source-code model empower clients to achieve their business goals while maintaining unparalleled ownership of the full technology stack.

**Title: Strategy & Operations Business Partner - Professional Services**


**Mandate**



Beacon Platform is looking for a Strategy & Operations Business Partner, reporting to the Senior Business Partner for Strategy & Analytics.



The Strategy & Operations team at Beacon has 5 key missions:


***Strategy*** - Work with Beacon Heads of Businesses in setting and driving vision, strategy and operational effectiveness


***Analysis***- Establish goals and metrics and take responsibilities for removing blockers to achieve those goals


***Operations***- Drive business forward through translating short-term and long-term strategy into actions to ensure scalable growth


***Partnership***- Help build inclusive culture by partnering with team members to help them thrive and achieve their full potential at Beacon


***Alignment***- Enable cross-functional communication and projects spanning multiple business units

  



This role will act as a business partner to the Senior Vice President of Solutions & Delivery to make improvements within the Professional Services organization (supporting our teams that help clients onboard and expand their usage of Beacon). This is simultaneously a strategic and hands-on role, where a self-motivated, detail-oriented critical thinker will drive internal business initiatives, identify opportunities to make our teams more effective, and implement new processes as we grow to scale.

  


**Strategy & Analysis:**


* Envision, research and propose business initiatives within post sale client facing teams
* Define and establish appropriate metrics and KPIs for the organization
* Track and monitor PS Revenue and Profitability metrics to help the team achieve their goals
* Facilitate ad-hoc requests and special projects and provide insights to influence outcomes and add value to the different client success teams


**Operations:**


* Work through data-driven staffing and resource allocation processes to ensure high quality and good outcomes for our clients and ability to meet pipeline demand
* Manage the operations of working with third party consulting firms as resource augmentation for our Professional Services Organization
* Validate and monitor methodology for prioritization of initiatives
* Create and manage a customer satisfaction survey process
* Serve as administrator for the project management software tool


**Partnership & Alignment:**


* Provide support for business management
* Partner with Finance, Sales, Marketing, and Engineering on projects or other business related matters
* Develop rapport with various team members and become a trusted advisor
* Work with 3rd party consulting firms to augment our resourcing needs

  


**Qualifications**



Required:


* + 3+ years in the software industry, preferably with SaaS experience and/or 3+ years experience in operations/consulting
	+ Proven success in running programs and processes that enable organizations to scale quickly and efficiently, leading to improvement in KPIs related to retention, expansion, and customer health
	+ Deep understanding of service delivery
	+ Familiarity with Professional Services/Consulting methodologies, metrics and KPIs
	+ Familiarity/Expertise in Project Management Software
	+ Strong quantitative skills and ability to analyze financial dataset
	+ Sound judgment and ability to challenge decisions when necessary
	+ A self-starter with the ability to independently research and arrive at and deliver conclusions
	+ Curiosity and desire to research / analyze the competitive landscape of the Financial Platform industry, and its associated ecosystem
	+ Experience in operations management or management consulting
* Preferred:
	+ Familiarity/Expertise in Salesforce.com
	+ Financial technology industry experience
	+ Understanding of financial products
  


Expected Salary Range: $125,000 - 150,000

  


**What You'll Love About Beacon**


* ***Unlimited PTO*** - This isn't your typical unlimited PTO plan. All employees take at least 20 days off a year. After that? Take the time off you need to strike the perfect work/life balance for you.
* ***401k match***
* ***Charitable donation match***
* ***Access to Udemy*** - An online learning and teaching marketplace with over 185,000 courses. Learn programming, marketing, data science, or brush up on your public speaking and writing skills.
* ***Startup Culture*** - Our employees have a voice and can make a big impact across the organization. A lot of people in large companies don't feel connected to what they're doing and feel like they're put in a box. Here you will have the freedom to be creative and innovative. We're looking for smart and driven people to help get us to the next level.

 *Beacon does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Beacon encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.*

title: Registered Dietitian (Part-time)
description:
***Join Our Team of Registered Dietitians Part Time at NutraCo!***

Are you a compassionate and driven Registered Dietitian seeking a rewarding career in clinical nutrition?

NutraCo, a leading provider of Clinical Nutrition Services to Long Term Care facilities across the United States, has an exciting opportunity for you!

We are currently seeking a motivated individual to join us as an Onsite Registered Dietitian, located near Bloomingdale, NJ. This is a part-time position offering a competitive hourly rate for the right motivated individual.

**Please apply to find out more!**

***Why Choose NutraCo?***

At NutraCo, we pride ourselves on delivering compassionate care with respect and dignity to residents in Long Term Care facilities nationwide. When you join our team, you become part of a supportive environment where your contributions are valued and acknowledged.

*Here are just a few reasons to consider a career with NutraCo:*

* **Room for Growth:** We offer development opportunities and upward mobility within the company, empowering you to advance your career.
* **Collaborative Environment:** Join a network of dedicated dietitians who support and interact with each other, fostering a sense of community and teamwork.
* **Valued Professionalism:** Your work as a professional is highly valued and acknowledged at NutraCo, where your voice is heard, and feedback is encouraged and supported.
* **Clear Expectations**: We provide clear goals, directives, and feedback, ensuring you have the resources and support needed to excel in your role.
* **Opportunity for Relocation:** With multiple locations throughout the United States, NutraCo offers the flexibility to relocate if needed, allowing you to grow with us wherever life takes you.

***Responsibilities:***

As a Registered Dietitian at NutraCo, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the lives of our residents by addressing nutrition-related health problems through clinical nutrition treatment.

*Your responsibilities will include:*

* Providing compassionate care and support to residents, focusing on their nutritional needs and well-being.
* Collaborating with other dietitians and facility clinical team to deliver personalized nutrition plans and ensure the highest level of care.
* Completing necessary clinical assessments, charting within the EMR system, and attending meetings to discuss resident care and progress.
* Conducting meal rounds if/as needed, completing sanitation audits, and signing off on dietary menus to maintain quality standards.

***Requirements:***

*To succeed in this role, you must meet the following requirements:*

* Registered Dietitian with the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) or Registration Eligible with a Verification Statement
* State licensure guidelines must be met, along with facility vaccination as required.
* Strong communication skills, effective teamwork, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly regulated environment.

***Salary and Benefits Offered Include:***

* Competitive rates starting at $30/hr. DOE
* Comprehensive Benefits Package Options Include:

- Company Managed 401(k) Program  
- Continuing Education Credits  
- Life and Disability Insurance Options  
- Employee Discounts as Applicable.?????????

*Are you a dedicated Registered Dietitian looking to join a supportive team and make a difference in the lives of residents?* ***We want to hear from you!***

***Apply now*** *to join NutraCo and embark on a rewarding career journey in clinical nutrition!*

title: Data Scientist - EV Charging Infrastructure
description:
**About Revel**



Revel's mission is to accelerate EV adoption in cities by providing the infrastructure and services that make it easy to go electric. Revel operates the nation's first all-electric rideshare service, which delivers thousands of rides across New York City every day. Revel is also the leading public fast charging provider in New York, with stations in Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens, and more on the way. Founded in Brooklyn in 2018, Revel first began as a shared electric moped platform and has since grown to be a top partner for big cities pursuing an electric vehicle future — first in New York, with other markets to come soon.


**Our Operating Principles**



Revel's Operating Principles represent who we are, how we act, and what we believe. They define our culture.


**Empathy.** We seek to understand the experiences and perspectives of each other, our customers and the communities where we operate.


**Ownership.** We are excited by big challenges and care deeply about our work. We empower and rely on each other and hold ourselves to a high standard.


**Humility.** We take our work seriously but not ourselves. We're approachable, curious, and know we have a lot to learn.


**Adaptability.** We expect change and quickly adjust our approach to reflect new information. We know success requires seeing opportunity in obstacles and relentlessly improving.


**Simplicity.** We clarify and prioritize what can be done now. We strive to keep things no more complicated than absolutely required.

### **Title : Data Scientist - EV Charging Infrastructure**


### **Location : NYC-Based**

  


### **About the Role**



We're looking for a Data Scientist who can lead the development of predictive models and analytical tools used for decision making within our EV Charging Infrastructure business line. This role will work cross-functionally with multiple teams to drive growth and efficiency, including Product, Engineering, Charging Operations and Business.


**Responsibilities**


* Lead Data Science initiatives to guide strategic and operational decisions for EV Infrastructure expansion and Charging Operations
* Iterative development of our existing models and tools currently used for Charging Operations, Site Selection and New Market Sizing.
* Build dashboards and conduct analytics to support pricing and charging efficiency related initiatives. Translation of data / insights into meaningful and actionable recommendation to business leads across the organization
* Building deep knowledge of internal & external data sources. Use this knowledge to enhance and iterate on current models and tools.

### **Technical Requirements**


* 3+ years experience working as a Data scientist/Data analyst
* Proficient in SQL and either Python or R
* Knowledge of a variety of statistical techniques, including regression, time series forecasting, machine learning, A/B testing and their advantages and drawbacks
* Proficient in processing and analyzing geospatial data
* Experience with data visualization tools such as Mode, Looker, Tableau etc.


**Nice to Haves:**


* Experience in the EV Charging, Transportation or Energy industry
* Familiarity with AWS services such as S3, EC2 and Redshift
* Experience with Postgres / Snowflake databases
* Familiarity with GitHub or other version control software tools

  


### **Non-Technical Requirements**


* You are self-driven and enthusiastic about the company vision, our product and the underlying mathematical problems we are solving
* Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to summarize key findings into clear and actionable recommendations, and to interact with individuals at all levels
* Strong project management skills and ability to plan and prioritize work in a fast-paced environment
* You take your work seriously but not yourself


**Compensation and Benefits**



Base compensation range of $120k-$150k per year, based on experience level. Our benefits package includes:


* Stock Options
* Discounted Rideshare rides
* Medical, Dental, Vision
* 401k
* Life insurance
* Unlimited Vacation/PTO


Revel is an equal opportunity employer. All facets of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or release, will be based on merit, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

The machine-readable files are formatted to allow researchers, regulators, and application developers to more easily access and analyze data.*

title: Executive Assistant to CEO
description:
Our firm owns and operates multiple entities. We are involved in accounting, tax preparation Service, Digital marketing, real estate brokerage, real estate investments, etc. You will be working directly with the President/CEO and the executive team of the company. This job comes with the opportunity to grow within our framework.

The daily routine will change often but listed below are some of the job requirements and skill sets needed.
