title: Bilingual Spanish Required (30hours)Associate Banker -Paterson Branch -Paterson NJ
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  


We have an obsession for taking care of our customers and employees and making them feel welcomed and valued through building lasting relationships, doing the right thing, exceeding expectations, and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Using the latest banking solutions combined with cutting-edge financial technology and the most welcoming and friendly service, you will be front and center representing our brand and culture. You will have the opportunity to help people experience our Customer Promise - helping people make the most of their money so they can make the most of their lives, by providing education, and advice tailored to suit their financial needs.  

  

As an Associate Banker in Branch Banking, you will contribute significantly to the success of the branch by delivering exceptional customer experiences. You will build long-lasting relationships with clients by sharing product knowledge and solutions as well as introducing them to our licensed bankers.  

  

**Job responsibilities**
* Engages clients as they enter the branch by welcoming them and making them feel appreciated, including managing lobby traffic, checking clients into the waiting queue and scheduling/canceling client meetings
* Helps clients with everyday transactions such as deposits, withdrawals, payments, reordering a debit card, setting up a direct deposit or helping update their address accurately and efficiently, while complying with all policies, procedures, and regulatory and banking requirements
* Educates clients on the usage of technology self-service options such as leveraging the Chase Mobile App, Chase.com, and ATMs to complete their banking needs whenever, wherever, and however they want
* Assists clients and the branch team by helping with new account openings when needed
* Performs branch operations which may include managing cash devices such as the cash vault, ATM, or others while adhering to all bank policies and procedures
**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**
* 6+ months of customer service experience
* High school diploma or GED equivalent
* Bilingual Spanish Required
**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills*** Ability to make personal connections, engage customers, and remain courteous and professional in a team environment while quickly and accurately learn products, services, and procedures
* Professional, interpersonal, thorough, detailed oriented, and organized with follow-up skills
* Strong desire and ability to influence, educate, and connect customers to technology
* Cash handling experience

title: Technology Operational Risk Management Director (Tech & Cyber) - Executive Director
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Bring your expertise to JPMorgan Chase. As part of Risk Management and Compliance, you are at the center of keeping JPMorgan Chase strong and resilient. You help the firm grow its business in a responsible way by anticipating new and emerging risks, and using your expert judgement to solve real-world challenges that impact our company, customers and communities. Our culture in Risk Management and Compliance is all about thinking outside the box, challenging the status quo and striving to be best-in-class.


As a Technology Operational Risk Management Director, you will be responsible for leading large complex programs and systems oversight associated to investment banking globally. You will need to be adept at evaluating technology practices for operational challenges in addition to cybersecurity related concerns and identify potential risks or evaluate existing risks globally. Additionally, you must have a proven ability to drive business results with their insights and be comfortable working with a wide range of technology, risk stakeholders, and functional teams.


You will need to leverage your experience in engineering, software development and technology operations in order to identify operating control or process deficiencies within the technology stack or organization that may result in operating disruption, compliance, or security issues. In addition to developing and executing an oversight plan, you will also develop and maintain credible relationships with first line stakeholders across compute, storage, database, and network products.


The Compliance, Conduct Operational Risk (CCOR) CIB Market Technology Risk lead reports directly into the Technology Operational Risk Officer and is responsible for analysis and identification of operational risks to business processes.


**Job Responsibilities**

* Identify technology operational risks stemming from events and incidents in disruption of CIB markets operations
* Identify operational risks stemming from large and/or impactful change activities
* Assess the alignment of the application areas against the modernization strategies
* Participate and challenge first line control implementation and execution
* Design and execute monitoring and testing activity to detect operational and compliance risks during the development lifecycle

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* 10+ years in an infrastructure or development leadership role
* Strong background in technology engineering
* Strong understanding of applications testing, quality control, change and release management
* Familiarity with strategic development tools (JIRA, Jenkins, Artifactory, etc.)
* Expertise with Cloud Technologies (i.e. AWS, GCP, Azure)
* Experience with ITSM, ITIL, with focus on Engineering processes
* Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals


**ABOUT US**  


JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. title: Internal Audit Practices Manager
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

This role is for an experienced audit professional to join the Practices Audit Team. Within our Internal Audit group, you will strengthen internal controls and have visibility from upper management.


As a Senior Auditor (Vice President) on the Professional Practices Audit team, you will be an audit subject matter expert to play a key role in influencing positive change throughout the audit department globally.


Internal Audit is an independent function at JPMorgan Chase that aims to enhance and protect the firm by providing risk-based and objective assurance, advice, and insight. We work with every Line of Business and Corporate Function to assess the internal control processes that drive our global business — identifying areas of improvement to help safeguard the firm. Using cutting-edge audit technology, data, methodology and sound judgement, we bring a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluating and improving the effectiveness of governance, risk management and controls. We’re proud of our reputation for excellence, integrity and collaboration - our priorities of strong governance, transparency and strategic engagement, along with our people-first culture centered around diversity, equity, inclusion, teamwork, career progression and continuous learning, have helped us create a coveted workplace where everyone feels like they belong. Our global team is made up of more than 1,200 talented and passionate individuals in more than 20 countries around the world.

**Job Responsibilities**

* Develop and deliver content focused on Internal Audit’s methodology and proprietary technology/tools
* Participate and drive change management reporting process for audit universe changes and risk assessment refreshes on a periodic basis.
* Participate in change management activities including impact analysis and post implementation reviews
* Determine audit methodology and tool-related knowledge/skill gaps by analyzing Internal Audit needs and performance goals of the audience, and collaborate with support partners to implement impactful solutions
* Partner in the design/implementation of new/enhanced Audit Practices to ensure they are appropriately rolled out and absorbed into execution and all downstream impacts are understood
* Develop reporting/metrics, as applicable.
* Respond to queries related to methodology from auditors
* Assist the Methodology team in routine policy/procedure updates and department queries
* Build and maintain key relationships across the Audit department, establishing a culture of engagement and adding value to the department

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* 6+ years of experience in Internal Audit, a financial services organization, public accounting or consulting firm, or related industry
* Bachelor's degree required
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills required
* Skills in Excel, PowerPoint and analytical skills; ability to articulate complex processes that are easy to understand
* Experience in speaking and presenting to large audiences as well as smaller groups
* Organizational skills and attention to detail
* Ability to work with various levels within the organization

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Advanced degree
* Professional certification, such as CPA, CIA, CISA, CFE, or equivalent certification desired

title: Planning and Analysis, Lead Product Owner - Executive Director
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

The Finance function is a dynamic organization that plays a critical role, particularly as increasing regulatory and capital requirements change the way we do business. Planning & Analysis (P&A), in addition to CFO teams, Controllers, Business Managers, and Project management, make up the majority of the Global Finance team.


The P&A Innovation & Transformation function consists of a team of Product Managers, Data Modelers, and Solution Delivery professionals who deliver innovative products and solutions that enable advanced use of data and technology to drive process optimization and enhanced analytics for Finance, P&A, and Business Management functions.


We are looking for an outstanding product manager with experience in working in a matrixed organization to build the next generation of digital products and services on our modern, cloud-based platform.


One of the key products is Finance Research Analytics and Modeling Engine (FRAME). FRAME - an in-house application that leverages Databricks capabilities to provide a cloud-native Finance Research, Analytics and Modeling Engine (FRAME). It consists of a set of intuitive and self-service analytics and modelling capabilities with simplified deployment workflows requiring low touch technology team interaction. The target personas are Data Analysts, Business Developers, Statistical Modelers, ML Engineers, Data Scientists and Model Executors.


**Job responsibilities:**

* Define and communicate the product vision and strategy aligned our business goals, incorporating emerging technologies and trends.
* Develop and maintain a product roadmap, prioritize features based on business value and customer needs, and oversee the entire product lifecycle from ideation to post-launch optimization.
* Advocate for the customer by ensuring products meet user needs and deliver exceptional experiences, while gathering and analyzing feedback for continuous improvement.
* Understand agile software development processes and work closely with engineers and data scientists to develop products using cloud-based tools (e.g., AWS, Databricks, MLFlow, Python).
* Analyze large data sets to extract insights and trends, define and track key performance indicators (KPIs), and use data-driven insights to optimize product performance.
* Collaborate with senior executives and cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and support for product initiatives, acting as the primary point of contact for key stakeholders.
* Communicate clearly and persuasively to various audiences, providing regular updates and gathering feedback to ensure alignment and support.
* Lead and mentor a team of product managers and other professionals, fostering a culture of innovation and collaboration, and providing guidance for the team's success and professional growth.
* Ensure products comply with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices, while identifying and mitigating risks associated with product development and deployment.

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills:**

* MS/MBA degree or equivalent experience
* 15+ years of experience in product management, with a proven track record of leading successful product initiatives.
* Ability to set and manage accountabilities and expectations at all levels - team members, peers, business partners and senior management
* Proficiency in statistical and machine learning techniques, with the ability to apply these methods to financial forecasting and risk assessment.
* Strong technical skills, including experience with programming languages such as Python, R, or SAS, and familiarity with data visualization tools.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to accuracy and precision.
* Excellent communication and presentation abilities, with the capacity to influence and inspire stakeholders at all levels.
* Customer-centric mindset with a passion for delivering exceptional user experiences.
* High level of adaptability and resilience in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

title: Investment Banking - Equity Capital Markets, Converts - Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Analyst to join our dynamic Equity Capital Markets team, offering an exceptional opportunity to contribute to high-profile transactions and drive growth within a leading financial institution.


**Job Summary**


As an Analyst in the Equity Capital Markets team in the Investment Banking Division, you will be a key player in the execution of the firm's business. You will work with expert professionals at the heart of a leading global investment bank. Senior bankers will get to know you - both as a person and as a valued member of a winning team. You will experience training, hands-on learning opportunities, continuous mentoring and feedback, and numerous development opportunities. You will use your related experience to contribute to the firm's M&A execution and capital raising capabilities while helping build J.P. Morgan's franchise and reputation in the marketplace. You will develop strong functional skills in the major areas of investment banking and become a senior client executive who is capable of generating and executing your own transactions. Joining here means you’ll become part of our inclusive teams and culture, unified by the firm’s mission and commitment to success.


**Job Responsibilities**


* Execute transactions: support due diligence, document preparation, negotiation etc and liaising with relevant counterpart at the client/other advisers (accounting, legal, etc)
* Working with J.P. Morgan product and sector teams
* Building and using complex financial models, completing valuation and analytical exercises
* Drafting presentation materials, management presentations, Board materials, Memorandums, and other presentation materials for use in M&A and capital markets transactions or strategic client dialogue Keeping abreast of key market developments and establishing knowledge of the target client base and relevant market dynamics

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**


* Prior work experience in an investment banking front office, or related, role.
* Strong accounting, finance, quantitative and business writing skills.
* A well-rounded academic background from a top tier educational institution.
* Understanding of the transaction cycle and the steps in the process and is execution oriented.
* Impeccable communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with senior professionals, clients and key stakeholders in other line of business.

title: Chase Strategy Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

When someone joins the Chase Corporate Strategy team, they accelerate their career by working on impactful and complex projects with high visibility. They also become part of a highly collaborative team that prioritizes learning, professional development, and mentorship.


As an Analyst in the Chase Corporate Strategy team, you will be involved in high-priority projects that are at the top of our senior management's agenda and at the forefront of the industry. Your responsibilities will include developing growth strategies, launching new products and entering new markets, forming partnerships or acquisitions, and initiating cross-line of business projects. These projects are team-based and will require you to collaborate extensively with senior executives and cross-functional business partners. You will also have the opportunity to rotate across Chase's lines of business and functional groups, including Consumer & Business Banking, Credit Card & Connected Commerce, Home & Auto Lending, Wealth Management, Product & Technology, HR, and Operations.

**Job responsibilities**

* Develop and drive the strategic priorities for Chase, serving as an objective thought partner to the C-suite and other senior leaders
* Collaborate with teams across LOBs and functional areas (e.g., data science, finance, product, marketing)
* Structure and build quantitative and qualitative analyses
* Analyze operational and financial data
* Research and analyze industry landscape to evaluate new opportunities and identify emerging trends
* Support creation of CEO-level executive communications

* Experience in strategy consulting, corporate strategy, startups (FinTechs), investment banking, private equity / venture capital, strategic finance, or similar roles

* Excellent analytical skills and ability to structure complex problems

title: Product Manager, Growth - The Infatuation
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

The Infatuation, part of Chase Dining, provides trustworthy and useful restaurant recommendations around the world. As part of the Product team, you will have the opportunity to set and execute strategic goals, conduct product discovery, and gain an in-depth understanding of our users. You will collaborate with Data, Marketing and Editorial to ensure that our products meet the needs of our users and drive business results.


As a Product Manager, Growth in the Infatuation, you will have the autonomy to solve complex problems to achieve meaningful outcomes. We value results over output and we are committed to continuous improvement. We are looking for someone who is passionate about product-led growth and metric-optimization, but rooted in user empathy. Join our dynamic team and help us continue to redefine the food and travel industry!

* Work with cross-functional teams, including design, engineering and data to drive growth and retention across our mobile app and website
* Analyze user behavior and usage data to identify opportunities for improvement
* Collaborate with stakeholders to define product vision, strategy, and roadmaps that align with business goals and user needs

title: Lead Associate Operations - LI South / LI Northwest Markets - Rockville Centre, NY
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  


We have an obsession for taking care of our customers and employees and making them feel welcomed and valued through building lasting relationships, doing the right thing, exceeding expectations, and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Using the latest banking solutions combined with cutting-edge financial technology and the most welcoming and friendly service, you will be front and center representing our brand and culture. You will have the opportunity to help people experience our Customer Promise - helping people make the most of their money so they can make the most of their lives, by providing education and advice tailored to suit their financial needs.  

  

As a Lead Associate - Operations in Branch Banking, you support the Branch Manager and Associates to ensure customer financial transactions are completed accurately and efficiently, while complying with all policies, procedures, and regulatory banking requirements. You will make customers feel welcomed and valued by building lasting relationships, doing the right thing, exceeding expectations, and having a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion.  

  

**Job responsibilities**
* Works with the Branch Manager to set the tone of the branch environment to provide an exceptional customer experience and a dynamic and engaging culture
* Processes and assist customers with transactions
* Introduces customers to the branch team who will build relationships and assist with specialized financial needs
* Makes customers’ lives easier by sharing and setting up self-service options to access their accounts 24 hours a day/ 7 days a week
* Supports the Branch Manager with all aspects of branch operations, including loss control, compliance, and audit standards

title: Relationship Banker-Milburn -Milburn NJ
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  


You have a passion for helping customers, building relationships, and delivering extraordinary customer service. You are energetic and enthusiastic as the face of Chase to our retail branch customers. From a personal standpoint, you will have the opportunity to take ownership of your career development through a variety of cross-training opportunities.  

  

As a Relationship Banker in Branch Banking, you will take a lead role in delivering an outstanding experience to Chase customers. You will acquire, manage, and retain meaningful relationships with our customers, using your financial knowledge to offer thoughtful solutions to help address their financial needs, contributing to the success of the branch. You will be making the lives of customers easier by sharing and setting up self-service options to access their accounts 24 hours a day/ 7 days a week.  

  

**Job responsibilities**  


* Delivers an exceptional customer experience by acting with a customer-first attitude
* Manages assigned customers and proactively meets with them, both in person and over the phone, to build lasting relationships, discover financial needs, and tailor product and service recommendations
* Makes personal connections, engages and educates customers, asks open-ended questions, and listens to establish trust and build lasting relationships
* Influences, educates, and connects customers to technology
* Possesses initiative and knowledge to provide financial options for customers using a consultative approach
* Learns products, services, and procedures quickly and accurately and delivers solutions that make our One Chase products work together
* Works in partnership with Specialists (Financial Advisors, Mortgage Bankers, and Business Relationship Managers) to connect customers to experts who can help them with specialized financial needs
**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**
* 1+ year of experience in Retail banking sales, Financial services sales, Consultative relationship sales role in a related industry, with proven success in establishing new clients, deepening customer relationships and delivering results
* High school degree, GED, or foreign equivalent
* Beginning October 1, 2018, the Securities Industry Essential (SIE) exam, FINRA Series 6/7, state registration (including 63 or 66 if required), and Life licenses are required. All unlicensed applicants must obtain their licenses within 180 days of hire
* Operate within established risk parameters/tolerances and meets internal/external risk and compliance obligations, including completion of required training
* Excellent communication skills, both in person and over the phone, with proven ability to tailor features and benefits of products/services to customers with differing needs
* Ability to work branch hours including weekends and some evenings
**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**
* College degree or military equivalent
* Professional, thorough, and organized with strong follow-up skills
* Exude confidence with clients when sharing product knowledge and solutions
* Experience adhering to policies, procedures, and regulatory banking requirements
**Dodd Frank/Truth in Lending Act**  

  

This position is subject to the Dodd Frank/Truth in Lending Act qualification requirements for Loan Originators. As such, an employment offer for this position is contingent on JPMC's review of your criminal conviction history, credit report, information available through NMLS, and any other information relevant to a determination by JPMC that you demonstrate financial responsibility, good character, and general fitness for the position. Note that any felony conviction within the last seven years will disqualify you from consideration for this position. Your continued employment in this position would be contingent upon compliance with Truth in Lending Act/Dodd Frank Loan Originator requirements.  

  

In addition, this position requires National Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLS) registration under the SAFE Act of 2008. As such, upon active employment with JPMorgan Chase, you will be required to either register on NMLS, or to update your existing registration as necessary to grant access to and reflect your employment with JPMorgan Chase. Your continued employment in this position with JPMorgan Chase is contingent upon compliance with the SAFE Act, including successful registration immediately after your start date, and timely completion of annual renewal and required updates thereafter.  

  

Any information obtained during the registration, update, and renewal processes or through NMLS notifications may impact your employment with the firm. Any of the completed information you provide during the Chase on-line application process may be transferred, on your behalf, to NMLS by JPMorgan Chase. Please carefully review the information you provide to Chase for accuracy and consistency and with any current NMLS record, if applicable, before submitting. Further information about NMLS and registration requirements of registration can be found at: http://mortgage.nationwidelicensingsystem.org/SAFE/Pages/default.aspx

title: Trade Support Public Finance Syndicate Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Are you looking for an exciting opportunity on the Trading Floor, to join a dynamic and growing team in a fast paced and challenging area? This is a unique opportunity for you to work in the Public Finance Syndicate Trade Support team to partner with the Business and provide a comprehensive view of Primary Markets.


As a Syndicate Trade Support Analyst within Market Operations, you will be working closely with Underwriters, Bankers, Sales, & Trading to execute various New Issuances from pre pricing to post closing across the Public Finance business
  

**Job responsibilities**

* Work on deal maintenance & set-up, including but not limited to Cusip requests, Trust creation, DTC eligibility, Scale updates and initiation of wires through IPREO
* Adhere to all Regulatory requirements and have an in depth understanding of MSRB rules (G-32, G-11 etc)
* Possess clear communication skills and an ability to use these to work collaboratively, explain, and challenge, as appropriate
* Review all deal related controls including deal documentation and wire communications to syndicate banks in accordance with MSRB and FINRA regulations
* Work closely with Operations, Settlements, Treasury, Banking, and the Underwriting desk to support a ‘one team approach’
* Have knowledge of the front to back Operations process (including the key elements such as confirmations, settlements, and regulatory reporting) and facilitate issue resolution across teams

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Strong attention to detail and ability to work efficiently under high pressure with great initiative and sense of ownership
* Understanding and knowledgeable of the Municipal/Public Finance Primary Market and Syndicate workflow space including TOBs, from pre pricing through settlement
* Product knowledge of TOB New Issuance as well as functionality, including DTC eligibility for Putters/Drivers, Trust creation & set up, Wire payments
* Ability to work efficiently under high pressure, while possessing strong analytical, problem solving and technical skills, especially in Excel (Bloomberg, Python, SQL, Alteryx and additional program languages are nice to have
* Strong problem solving, control, and project management skills
* Clear and concise communication with all support teams to ensure timely and efficient resolution of queries, as well as all controls are being met

title: Asset Management – Real Estate Americas Investor Relations - Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Real Estate Americas is housed within J.P. Morgan Global Alternatives in Asset Management. At over $70bn in AUM, the Real Estate Americas team is one of the largest managers of open-end real estate. The team has been managing real estate investments on behalf of our clients for 50 years, during which time we have established ourselves as a market leader. The team has 250 real estate professionals across 6 markets in the U.S. The team manages over 500 clients around the globe across our various real estate strategies spanning the risk spectrum and capital stack.




As an Investor Relations Associate within the Client Strategy team, you will contribute significantly to the Real Estate Americas investments marketing effort working primarily with internal clients (investment specialists, portfolio managers, research, investment teams and client advisors) and ultimately with external clients over time. You will work closely with investment specialists to service our existing clients, develop marketing strategy, marketing collateral, fund reporting, fund positioning, and develop and maintain competitive analysis on the industry landscape. Additionally, you will contribute to various strategic projects across the platform, for example, new fund launches.


**Job Responsibilities**

* Support the Real Estate Americas Investment Specialist team effort in servicing existing clients and acquiring new business.
* Prepare and execute client materials, including presentations and reporting deliverables.
* Contribute to and manage strategic projects from inception to completion, including idea generation, content creation, project management, stakeholder coordination, and client feedback management.
* Complete RFPs, RFIs, due diligence questionnaires, and quarterly/monthly client/consultant questionnaires, as well as handle ad hoc requests.
* Project manage client deliverables, ensuring timely execution, identifying overlaps, and driving coordination and efficiency.
* Develop an in-depth understanding of the Real Estate Americas organization, its business priorities, culture, and operating model.
* Build knowledge of real estate as an asset class, portfolio allocation, and the macro environment, and understand key metrics to inform client responses.
* Enhance the client experience by creating external touchpoints such as white papers, webcasts, and electronic newsletters/updates.
* Create and update analytical models to support client needs.
* Monitor industry databases and publications for relevant environment, competitive and marketing information.
* Frequent internal and external client contact.




**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* 3-5 years industry experience.
* A self-starter with the confidence, patience, maturity and a strategic lens to proactively advance agenda, navigate demanding internal/external product/client situations.
* Ability and desire to add value and contribute to the team’s efforts; present new ideas and initiatives.
* Ability to organize and prioritize a diverse and complicated workload under demanding time pressure. Timeliness and multitasking are critical.
* Strong communication (written and oral) and marketing/sales skills, required for both internal and external client deliverables.
* Ability to create compelling, thoughtful and creative presentation materials.
* Accuracy and attention to detail is essential with strong analytical acumen.
* Strong technical skills, including a proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel.
* Team player with a strong ethos of partnership and inclusion.
* Good understanding of the investment management industry and a willingness to learn and develop further. An interest and ‘passion’ for real estate investment.
* Series 7 and 63 certifications.




**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Real estate experience is beneficial, but not directly required.

title: Chase Strategy Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

When someone joins the Chase Corporate Strategy team, they accelerate their career by working on impactful and complex projects with high visibility. They also become part of a highly collaborative team that prioritizes learning, professional development, and mentorship.


As an Associate in the Chase Corporate Strategy team, you will be involved in high-priority projects that are at the top of our senior management's agenda and at the forefront of the industry. Your responsibilities will include developing growth strategies, launching new products and entering new markets, forming partnerships or acquisitions, and initiating cross-line of business projects. These projects are team-based and will require you to collaborate extensively with senior executives and cross-functional business partners. You will also have the opportunity to rotate across Chase's lines of business and functional groups, including Consumer & Business Banking, Credit Card & Connected Commerce, Home & Auto Lending, Wealth Management, Product & Technology, HR, and Operations.

**Job responsibilities**

* Develop and drive the strategic priorities for Chase, serving as an objective thought partner to the C-suite and other senior leaders
* Collaborate with teams across LOBs and functional areas (e.g., data science, finance, product, marketing)
* Structure and build quantitative and qualitative analyses
* Analyze operational and financial data
* Research and analyze industry landscape to evaluate new opportunities and identify emerging trends
* Support creation of CEO-level executive communications

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Minimum of 3 years of experience in strategy consulting, corporate strategy, startups (FinTechs), investment banking, private equity / venture capital, strategic finance, or similar roles
* Bachelor’s degree; excellent academic credentials / GPA
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Excellent analytical skills and ability to structure complex problems
* Intellectual curiosity and ability to learn new subjects quickly
* Proficient MS Excel and PowerPoint skills
* Open, collaborative, team-oriented operating style

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Undergraduate degree in Economics, Finance, Math, Engineering (or related field)
* Experience applying data analysis to solve business problems in fast-moving environments
* Experience with cross-functional collaboration, including influencing stakeholders and working with diverse teams

title: Applied AI ML Director, Executive Director
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

As an Applied AI ML Director on the team, you will have the opportunity to study complex business problems, propose appropriate solutions, and apply your expertise in advanced AI/ML algorithms to develop, test, and evaluate solutions for those problems.


You will work with the firm’s rich data pool from both internal and external sources using Python/Spark via AWS and other systems. You are expected to own the lifecycle of a defined project and work with other team members to drive delivery of impactful results. You are also expected to derive business insights from technical results and significantly contribute to discussions with our business stakeholders and partners. As a senior member on the team, you will also serve as a mentor to junior data scientists to foster a collaborative working environment.


**Job responsibilities**

* Actively develop thorough understanding of complex business problems and processes; discover opportunities for AI and ML solutions.
* Collaborate with business partners to drive data-led transformations of the businesses.
* Own machine learning development lifecycle activities and execute on crucial timelines and milestones.
* Lead tasks throughout a model development process including data wrangling/analysis, model training, testing, and selection.
* Generate structured and meaningful insights from data analysis and modelling exercise and present them in appropriate format according to the audience.
* Provide mentorship and oversight for junior data scientists to build a collaborative working culture.
* Partner with machine learning engineers to deploy machine learning solutions.
* Own key model maintenance tasks and lead remediation actions as needed.
* Stay informed about the latest trends in the AI/ML/LLM/GenAI research and operate with a continuous-improvement mindset.

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Econometrics).
* At least 8 years of relevant experience in applied AI/ML domain.
* In-depth expertise and extensive experience with ML projects, both supervised and unsupervised.
* Strong programming skills with Python, R, or other equivalent languages.
* Proficient in working with large datasets and handling complex data issues.
* Experience with broad range of analytical toolkits, such as SQL, Spark, Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, graph analytics, and neural nets.
* Excellent solution ideation, problem solving, communication (verbal and written), and teamwork skills.

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Familiarity with machine learning engineering and developing/implementing machine learning models within AWS or other cloud platforms.
* Familiarity with the financial services industry.

title: Applied AI ML Lead
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

DESCRIPTION:


Duties: Lead the development of scalable tools leveraging machine learning models to solve real-world problems in areas such as Time Series predictions or Natural Language Processing. Develop deep learning models. Collaborate with all lines of business and functions in the Corporate Investment Bank. Drive AI/ML projects. Suggest, collect, and synthesize requirements. Create roadmap for the deployment of a production-level machine learning application. Educate stakeholders on the benefits of various AI/ML approaches. Participate in broader technical architecture decisions to ensure best practices are widely adopted by the firm. Manage a cross functional team of data scientists and AI experts to identify as well as deliver AI bases solutions in functional areas like finance, controls and compliance.


QUALIFICATIONS:


Minimum education and experience required: Master’s Degree in Business Intelligence and Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning, AI, Computer Science, or related field of study plus 6 years of experience in the job offered or as Predictive Science, Applied AI ML Director, Principal Data Scientist, Data Scientist, or related occupation. The employer will alternatively accept a Bachelor’s degree in Business Intelligence and Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning, AI, Computer Science, or related field of study plus 8 years of experience in the job offered or as Predictive Science, Applied AI ML Director, Principal Data Scientist, Data Scientist, or related occupation.


Skills Required: Requires experience in the following: Statistics; Machine Learning; Natural Language Processing; Deep Learning; Recommender Systems and Graph Network Analysis; programming with Python and SQL; standard data science tooling including PySpark, Hive, R, AWS, and graph data modeling; applying AI ML algorithms; analyzing stakeholder requests and translating business problems into solvable data science problems and utilizing appropriate methodologies to provide solutions; using visualization designs to represent data science findings.


Job Location: 383 Madison Ave., New York, NY 10179. Telecommuting permitted up to 40% of the week.


Full-Time. Salary: $260,000 - $325,000 per year.

title: Technology, Risk & Controls Lead - Cybersecurity Governance
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** **Organization Description**


As a Technology, Risk & Controls Lead - Executive Governance at JPMorgan Chase within the Cybersecurity & Technology Controls Organization, you'll align within the firm’s access management, controls, and resiliency teams. You'll proactively and strategically partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. One priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable, and resilient.

**Job responsibilities:**


The responsibilities of the Technology Executive Governance, Metrics & Reporting will include the below:

* Lead planning and execution of the Global Technology Control Committee – the highest management-level tech control committee at the firm – including setting monthly agendas, maintaining a forward-looking calendar of potential topics, ensuring completion of charter, policy, and other requirements, overseeing meeting logistics/material distribution, and working directly with senior stakeholders
* Oversee regional technology governance committees and management forums, enabling review, discussion, and decision of challenges and opportunities across the organization
* Execute reporting and governance of overall controls, policies, issue management, and measurements, etc., providing insight to senior leaders into effectiveness of controls and inform governance work
* Work with respective senior global technology leadership to execute best-in-class content to disseminate special topics with a view of providing risk posture to senior management
* Establish and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including key cross-functional team leads, regulators, and auditors, to ensure compliance with legal, regulatory, and industry standards
* Analyzing changes to the KRIs, KPIs and Operational metrics for the various technology controls and proactively communicating the impact to the line of business' understanding the metrics and regulatory impact (if any)
* Tracking identified and proposed changes (via the Change Management process used for Communication) and providing information via regular weekly meetings to the Information Security Managers (ISMs), Technology Risk & Control Managers (TRCMs) and relevant stakeholders across different Regions/Countries
* Leading the effort to standardize the Technology Control Committee materials (based on firm wide standards) across all line of businesses & regions within JPMC with aim of achieving a common view of risk across the Firm
* Coordinating with cybersecurity and conduct high level gap analysis of the metrics by working with F&T (Findings & Treatment) team to accommodate the within regional/country requests based on regulatory requirements

**Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Obtain formal training and/or certification in Technology Risk and Compliance, Information Security, Corporate Governance, Metrics & Reporting, preferably at a global financial services organization and 5+ years of experience or equivalent expertise
* Strong ability to craft and deliver executive-level presentations that distill complex technology and cybersecurity topics into clear insights for non-technological business leaders
* Strong organizational skills with ability to communicate all levels of Senior Management across various JPMorgan Chase Lines of Businesses
* Strong execution focus with the ability to push for progress, follow tight deadlines, operate under pressure when required
* Ability to persuade and influence; to be tactful yet assertive with strong collaboration and negotiation skills
* Ability to develop and maintain strong client and stakeholder relationships
* Strategic mindset with strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills**

* Experience in leading or managing the execution of senior management-level governance committees and forums
* Extensive experience within technology, cybersecurity, and/or risk management domains
* Demonstrated experience in leveraging technology standards, frameworks, compliance, and best practice/standards relevant to the financial industry (e.g., ITIL, NIST, ISO, PCI, SOC)

title: 2025 Internal Audit Analyst Program - Full Time Analyst Opportunity - Jersey City
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** **2025 Internal Audit Analyst Program – Full-Time Analyst (Jersey City, NJ)**




If you are a passionate, curious individual who is enthusiastic about evaluating the effectiveness of controls across different areas of global business, operations and/or technology and identifying areas of improvement to help safeguard the firm, this role is for you. Using cutting-edge audit technology, data, methodology and sound judgement, we bring a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluating and improving the effectiveness of governance, risk management and controls.


As a Full-time Analyst in the Internal Audit Program, you will start with comprehensive training to introduce you to our firm, our practices and our culture. After training, you will join one of our lines of business (Asset & Wealth Management, Commercial Banking, Consumer & Community Banking, or Corporate & Investment Bank), Corporate Function or Technology Internal Audit teams.




Job responsibilities:

* Identify and analyze risks in our businesses and evaluating the controls established to mitigate those risks
* Test controls by reviewing documents, observing the teams and meeting with management
* Provide management with feedback regarding the effectiveness of the controls

* Focus on reviews of business applications, data management, global infrastructure, digital technologies and cyber/information security
* Evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of controls in our technology organization
* Provide management with feedback regarding the control environment




Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

* Pursuing a B.A., B.S., or 5th year M.A. or M.S., with an expected graduation date of December 2024 through July 2025
* Have a well-rounded academic background
* Bring exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Have the ability to manage time, prioritize and know when to seek help
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)




Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills


* All majors considered; Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems (MIS) or Computer Information Systems (CIS) focused majors are a plus
* Preferred minimum cumulative GPA of 3.2 on a 4.0 scale




Locations you can join:


* Jersey City, NJ




To be eligible for this program, you must be authorized to work in the U.S. We do not offer any type of employment-based immigration sponsorship for this program. Likewise, JPMorgan Chase & Co., will not provide any assistance or sign any documentation in support of any other form of immigration sponsorship or benefit including optional practical training (OPT) or curricular practical training (CPT).




What’s Next?




Submit a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume, select your preferred track (business or technology), and location preference. Your application and resume are a way for us to initially get to know you. It’s important to complete all relevant application questions, so we have as much information about you as possible. We will review your application to determine whether you meet the required criteria.




We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.




JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities.


Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.




JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity employer, including Disability/Veterans

title: Human Resources Business Advisor - Executive Director
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION** *HR Advisory*

* Develop and drive the end-to-end Human Resources (HR) strategy based on business priorities including identification, development and retention of talent
* Build a strong relationship with the management team, consulting proactively and frequently to drive relevant HR strategies that align to business and market requirements and challenges
* Partner effectively with regional and global Line of Business HR Business Advisors; advising them on policies, procedures and practices
* Play a key role in planning and executing on restructuring plans, performance matters, transfers, etc.

*Operational Effectiveness*

* Analyze HR trends and data to make recommendations for continuous improvement
* Help drive alignment and optimization of the HR operating model and digital solutions, both for HR and employees/managers.
* Establish and measure key people metrics, aligned with business goals through quarterly scorecards, and other key data via Workforce Analytics.

*Compliance Risk and Controls*

* Comply with local laws and regulations; interact with regulators; and complete regulatory submissions
* Ensure standard operating processes and controls for key HR processes are in place and signed-off
* Partner with Compliance, Legal, Audit, HR Risk & Controls, and HR Regulatory change management and controls.
* Provide HR insight and support on ER, conduct & litigation matters if/as appropriate

*Experience Portfolio / HR Product engagement*

* Partner with Total Rewards on ensuring competitive and relevant local market comp and benefits
* Partner with the Talent Development function to build and drive the development and leadership agenda. Drive cross-lines of Business talent reviews and succession plans as appropriate
* Understand the drivers of employee engagement and facilitate discussions and location-wide analysis to understand and influence change to the work environment.
* Build Diversity and Inclusion metrics/plan and act as a proactive member of / advisor to the Business Resource Group

*Projects and Initiatives*

* M&A Human Resources due diligence in partnership with Product teams as needed. .
* Answer internal requests for information from HR, Compliance, Legal. Third Party Oversight (TPO)

*HR Team Management*

* Provide operational oversight, career and development advice
* Provide input on staffing decisions, performance development (written reviews), talent reviews, promotion meetings and compensation planning
* Drive culture, conduct and collaboration well as manage team Employee Opinion Survey

**Required Qualifications, Capabilities and Skills:**

* Minimum of 10+ years of human resources experience
* Knowledge of multiple HR disciplines
* Negotiation skills & conflict management skills – ability to mediate, negotiate and facilitate differences amongst diverse stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate and lead and manage teams across businesses in a matrixed environment
* Excellent interpersonal skills and influencing skills and the ability to establish strong relationships with Line of Business Executives, HR Business Advisors and Various HR global teams
* Excellent communication and cultural awareness skills
* Strategic thinker and pragmatic problem solver who is able to connect the dots, anticipate issues, and develop succinct recommendations and implementation plans
* Exceptional consulting, negotiation, coaching and presentation skills
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to quickly assess situations
* Demonstrated ability to create a strong risk, control and conduct mindset across a matrixed functional team
* Ability to manage significant change agendas
Same Posting Description for Internal and External Candidates

title: U.S. Corporate Wellness & Benefits, Vice President
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

The JPMorgan Chase Wellness Team sits within the Global Benefits organization and is responsible for strategy, evaluation, implementation and oversight of various well-being programs. This includes monitoring program performance, regulations, evaluating marketplace trends, and taking an active part in the design and implementation of the firm’s overall wellness and benefits initiatives.


As a Corporate Wellness and Benefits Vice President, your primary responsibilities will be to develop and implement the on-site benefit amenity strategy and develop processes to streamline oversight for on-site delivery of well-being programs with the lens of improving the overall employee experience. This is a hybrid role, based in Jersey City, NJ.


**Job responsibilities**

* Development of global strategy for existing and future on-site well-being offerings including framework for decision making and global standards for key program elements
* Assisting with managing the day-to-day operations of the firm’s wellness offerings in areas such as budget oversight, operational oversight, centralizing and tracking, risk assessment findings management and other vendor requirements
* Tracking deliverables across internal and external stakeholders, understanding reporting/financials, participating in risk/compliance work, helping to manage the customer experience and assisting with driving operational excellence across well-being programs and offerings
* Assisting with evaluation and implementation of ad hoc wellness offerings or enhancements to the existing program, which include conducting research and analyses, defining success measures, preparing materials for senior management review and approval, and developing communication materials
* Working with the broader wellness and benefit design teams in developing and implementing innovative ways to engage employees in their overall well-being
* Supporting on-site operations and vendor onboarding and oversight
* Monitoring wellness and healthcare trends and regulations including wellness incentives; analyzing program usage
* Partnering with internal stakeholders including other vendor managers, administration, corporate strategy, customer service, communications, finance, HR technology, legal, IT security, sourcing and global wellness teams

**Required qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Understanding of the healthcare and wellness marketplace, in particular as it relates to large employer plans/programs
* Vendor management experience
* Willingness and ability to innovate in order to drive fresh and/or unique approaches and solutions
* Must have experience working in a strategic, analytical or metric driven position
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, time sensitive environment
* Ability to multi-task, work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple deliverables
* Strong and effective verbal and written communication skills, including strong presentation skills
* Strong project management and operations skills, with a high level of attention to detail
* Solid knowledge of standard desktop applications such as MS Office (PowerPoint/PitchPro, Excel)
* Bachelor’s degree required and a minimum of 3 years in corporate benefits, benefits/wellness consulting or health plan/health insurance for wellness field

**Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills**

* Ideal to have large firm experience (10,000 plus employees)

title: Specialist, Quality Assurance
description:
**Job Summary:**  

This position is part of the Quality, External Operations team. Under the supervision of the Director, the Specialist ensures compliance with cGMP and company policies, procedures, and specifications.
  
  

This position ensures that Shiseido cosmetic and OTC products manufactured at CM’s meet specification, Quality protocols and methodology and requirements in accordance with cGMP and any related company SOP’s and FDA regulations. This role also coordinates resolutions to consumer and/or customer complaints, acting as a liaison with QA/QC, Operations Product Development, R&D, PD, Packaging, and other groups necessary to satisfy customer requests. Requiring very minimal supervision, compiles customer specific complaint data as needed.
  
  

The Quality Assurance Specialist position is fully responsible for the support on pilot batching, scale up, line trials, up to first production of new product launches at a contract manufacturer (CM) of both Cosmetic and OTC products
  
  

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Liaise between cross functional departments (R&D, QA, PD, Packaging, NPD, NPC, Planning, Procurement…etc.) and CM to ensure a successful product launch and/or investigation resolution leading to root cause and corrective/preventive action.
  
Ability and skill to effectively manage multiple complaints/NCPs simultaneously and drive timely execution.
  
Ability to lead and support ISO 22716 audits and ensure proper closure of all findings with the Contract Manufacturers.
  
Capable of trouble-shooting bulk manufacturing, filling, and packaging related issues.
  
Participates or drives the Quality Vendor Compliance Manual training (as required).
  
Review, coordinate, and author SOP, WI, and form(s) in the External Operation Quality Department and support routine review of controlled documents.
  
Ensure proper documentation, investigation, and closure of each complaint and/or NCP in accordance to established procedures.
  
Perform weekly, monthly, and customer specific data trending and compile complaint data tables and/or graphs as required
  
Work with Quality team and CMs to meet target PPM goals and reduce number of repeat complaints and NCPs.
  
Support department and organizational goals and objectives.
  
Conduct training with others (both internal and external) to ensure test procedures and work instructions are understood and applied correctly.
  
Limited travel may be required
  
All other duties as required and requested.
  
  

**Working Relationships/Key Stakeholders:**  

**Horizontal:** Quality Specialist, Packaging Engineer, Planner, NPC, NPD, MSP, Buyer.
  
**Vertical:** Quality Director, Planning Manager, Buyer Manager, NPD Manager
  
Work side-to-side with contract manufacturers and vendors to assure product Quality and compliance to local, state, and federal requirements.
  
Collaborate with Quality Assurance, Quality Control, Packaging Engineering, NPD, and NPC in the collection of specifications, artwork, standards, etc.
  
  

**Financial Accountability:**  

Actively support Finance Department with the resolution of blocked/non- conforming materials at contract manufacturers and/or distribution center.
  
Adhere to company's T&E policy.
  
  

**Qualifications & Competencies:**  

Bachelor’s degree (relevant work history and/or experience may be considered in lieu of degree) with minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
  
Familiarity with ISO 22716 standard. Auditor Certification preferred
  
ASQ - Certified Quality Improvement Associate (CQIA) is highly desired
  
Familiarity with root cause analysis tools
  
Knowledge in basic math and statistics.
  
Ability to read and interpret specifications and drawings.
  
Hands-on experience with basic measuring equipment.
  
Basic knowledge of MS-Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio).
  
Able to lift, stand or walk constantly all shifts as needed.
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills at all levels of the organization.
  
Adaptable to changes in the work environment, manage competing demands and deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
  
Works independently, requiring minimum supervisory direction.
  
Takes initiative and is self-motivated.
  
  

**Trust 8 Competencies:**  

Below is a list of Trust 8 Competencies designed to help employees at Shiseido Americas succeed as the company continues to evolve and innovate.
  
  

**1. Think Big:** Adapt a big-picture perspective. Deliver new values through creativity.
  
**2. Take Risks:** Embrace Risk, Practice “Trial and Error and Trial”.
  
**3. Hands On:** Consider Front-line realities when making decisions. Take the lead from end to end.
  
**4. Collaborate:** Leverage the diverse capabilities of colleagues.
  
**5. Be Open:** Create an environment that encourages everyone to speak up.
  
**6. Act with Integrity:** Be sincere and humble at all times.
  
**7. Be Accountable:** Commit to the goal. Take accountability for the execution.
  
**8. Applaud Success:** Create a culture that celebrates success.
  
  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.
  
**Requisition ID:** 14123
company_description: Shiseido Americas Corporation is a subsidiary of Tokyo-based Shiseido Company, Limited, a leading global beauty company.

title: Manager, Lean Six Sigma
description:
**Job Summary:**  

The Manager, Lean Six Sigma will provide support to senior management and the Director, Lean Six Sigma to strategically plan, organize and implement World Class lean principles throughout the organization with strong focus on 5S+Safety and Lean Six Sigma methodology. The role will support the analysis, facilitation and reporting functions and will be responsible for driving change that will improve quality, reduce costs and establish appropriate process metrics and controls for the region (SAI, SAC, Millstone and ADC). The Manager, Lean Six Sigma educates, executes, trains and leads 5S+Safety and lean initiatives throughout all levels of the organization to implement process improvements and increase efficiencies for optimal performance. The LSS Manager embraces and helps implement a vision of continuous improvement.
  
  

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities:**  

Provides support to Senior Leadership for the development of strategic plan for implementation of a World Class Organization (WCO).
  
Develop a culture of continuous improvement. Uses data to communicate and support the opportunities that exist.
  
Provide direction, suggestions, and influence to Senior Leadership for development of strategic plan for implementation of LSS.
  
Lead training in Lean Six Sigma to create “belted” associates at SAI, SAC and Millstone.
  
Achievement of identified cost savings / avoidance at SAI through the development of best practices and projects utilizing LSS methodologies.
  
Identify key improvement projects and initiatives that will deliver optimal savings in cost, quality and productivity.
  
Methodological support on various projects throughout the plant.
  
Interface with all supporting functions.
  
Trains and coaches support staff in the use of continuous improvement and LSS tools.
  
Supports leadership in the training and use of 5S+Safety and Lean Six Sigma tools and methodology.
  
Serves as a change agent to challenge the existing processes in place.
  
Provides methodological support on various projects throughout the plant.
  
Supports team resources and/or facilitates Kaizen events and Lean Six Sigma projects.
  
Works in coordination with leadership to support attainment of mission goals, requirements and sustainment of the process, standards and guidelines.
  
Perform other duties as may be assigned.
  
  

**Working Relationships/Key Stakeholders:**  

Director, Human Resources Business Partner
  
Vice President, Manufacturing & Plant Manager
  
SAI Management members (Directors, Managers and Supervisors)
  
Floor Leads
  
Budget/Sales etc. (if applicable)
  
Responsible for leading projects (Kaizen Events) that generate targeted savings.
  
Responsible for managing the department within the assigned budget amounts.
  
  

**Qualifications & Competencies:**  

Bachelor’s degree in engineering or business
  
5-8 years of experience in a fully integrated manufacturing environment managing lean, continuous improvement and/or Kaizen programs and projects
  
Green Belt certification in Lean Six Sigma required; Black Belt certification will be required after hire.
  
Strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with all levels of employees and outside professionals.
  
Experience with data gathering and data analysis.
  
Demonstrated expertise to lead change and initiate organizational changes.
  
Demonstrated strategic agility and broad knowledge and perspective in planning future activities.
  
Excellent project management skills and ability to drive results.
  
Outstanding PC/System knowledge and skills, including the ability to build, maintain and analyze internal databases. Experience with Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, Access and project management software.
  
Ability to consistently stand and walk on concrete floor, climb stairs and occasionally lift and carry up to 40 lbs.
  
  

Trust 8 Competencies
  
Below is a list of Trust 8 Competencies designed to help employees at Shiseido Americas succeed as the company continues to evolve and innovate.
  
**Think Big:** Adapt a big-picture perspective. Deliver new values through creativity.
  
**Take Risks:** Embrace Risk, Practice “Trial and Error and Trial”.
  
**Hands On:** Consider Front-line realities when making decisions. Take the lead from end to end.
  
**Collaborate:** Leverage the diverse capabilities of colleagues.
  
**Be Open:** Create an environment that encourages everyone to speak up.
  
**Act with Integrity:** Be sincere and humble at all times.
  
**Be Accountable:** Commit to the goal. Take accountability for the execution.
  
**Applaud Success:** Create a culture that celebrates success.

title: Procurement Analyst
description:
**Job description:**

The primary objective of this position is to implement a well-defined, well-documented process to ensure that contractual expectations and objectives are met as it relates to information technology and telecommunications service and material providers. Manage the development, negotiation and implementation of major technology and telecommunications related contracts leveraging spend, continuing to re-source recurring contractual commitments on a recurring cycle, manage emergent project work in support of operations, and manage key supplier relationships. Work closely with technology and telecommunication firms to ensure warranties, transfer of ownership, and other contractual agreements are met.

The position has responsibility to assure continuity of supply for all key contracted materials and services. In addition, this position handles technically complex projects and commercial negotiations that occur regularly in support of maintenance and operations.

The primary responsibilities for this position are the management and administration of contracts for various information technology projects being undertaken including:

(a) managing change orders, claims and back charges;

(b) asserting warranty claims;

(c) developing methods for assessing contractor performance;

(d) dispute resolution and

(e) implementing the appropriate processes and controls for protecting and preserving the Company’s contractual rights and remedies.

For new contracts, this position will be responsible for planning, developing and coordinating innovative contracting strategies and solutions with client personnel, assisting in clearly and completely defining the scope of work, and assessing the qualifications and capabilities of contractors through RFPs or other processes for $1.5M to $10M contracts.  
The IT Procurement Analyst will also lead commercial negotiations. The IT Procurement Analyst reports to the IT Operations Procurement Manager.

**Required Skills, Competencies, Education and Experience:**

* B.S./B.A. Degree
* 6-10 years large contract management experience.
* 7 years IT and telecommunications service management experience
* Excellent presentation and communication skills, both verbal and written, are mandatory, as well as a sound

understanding of technology and telecommunications projects and scheduling.

* Demonstrated ability to:

o appropriately assess contractual risk and implement risk management strategies;  
o implement measures and methods to tie payment to performance;  
o monitor and manage cost and change;  
o define and manage deliverables and respective responsibilities between the Company and the contractor.

* Valid driver’s license
* Demonstrated excellent negotiating skills.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $49.00 - $51.00 per hour

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* IT/ Information technology: 7 years (Required)
* Telecommunication: 7 years (Required)
* Procurement: 7 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Hicksville, NY 11815

title: Facilities Team Member
description:
**PART-TIME FACILITIES TEAM MEMBER IN AN ACUPUNCTURE STUDIO**

**69W 71st Street New York, NY** 

WTHN is a fast-growing young brand disrupting the acupuncture and natural healing industries and is seeking a **Facilities Team Member** who has a passion for organization, cleanliness, and helping others live their healthiest lives.

**WHO WE ARE**

We’re aiming to bring natural healing to a much bigger audience – through accessibility and transparency and by helping consumers create a wellness routine around acupuncture and herbs. Our herbal products are available nationally direct-to-consumer and our first retail studio opened in Manhattan’s Flatiron neighborhood in the fall of 2018. We have a beautiful healing oasis opening in Williamsburg Brooklyn, a place where our clients - stressed out, burned out and in pain - can come to escape and heal, and would love to have you join our team.

**THIS ROLE IS FOR YOU IF…**

You are attentive and efficient in a well-maintained, clean environment. You want to grow within your work environment and are constantly striving to help the overall operations of the studio. You’re excited to contribute to building a collaborative culture and team from the ground up and take on a rewarding role in a fast-paced, dynamic start-up environment.

**JOB EXPECTATIONS AROUND STUDIO CLEANING**

* Adhere to extensive COVID19 cleaning procedures + protocols, including regular sanitation of client + staff spaces
* Maintain exceptional cleanliness and organization to the entire WTHN studio
* Maintain a positive attitude and take initiative to ensure an efficient and healthy space for everyone who enters
* Quickly and with extreme attention to detail complete ongoing daily tasks in addition to maintaining overall cleanliness throughout the space
* Get to know our clients to deliver personal experiences
* Maintain studio cleanliness to surpass industry standards

**JOB EXPECTATIONS AROUND OPERATIONS**

* Complete the ongoing tasks of laundry and dishwashing throughout the entirety of every shift
* Follow and complete cleaning checklists for numerous areas in the WTHN space
* Assist with the execution and deconstruction of in-studio events.
* Actively provide suggestions and best practices to your team to ensure cost effectiveness, efficiency, and overall team success

**QUALIFICATIONS FOR THE ROLE**

* Must have professional cleaning experience; preferred experience in hospitality, health/wellness, or fitness spaces
* Superior attention to detail
* Highly organized with the ability to complete multiple tasks per shift
* Must be willing to initiate tasks and perform duties without direction
* Must have a positive attitude and friendly demeanor
* Available to work flexible/non-traditional hours including weekends and some holidays
* Personal passion for wellness and/or the natural healing movement
* Able to work with a team and also independently

Pay: $17.00 - $18.00 per hour

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Night shift
* Weekends as needed
